text: One of the best non-commercialized burgers I've ever had. Thickness is good, diameter of the patties are large, and they're nice and juicy too. Definitely recommend this place if you want an excellent home-cooked burger. Fries were great too.

I am fir the idea that the chuck box is a great restaurant . Firstly in my opinion , it ia cheep . For example , the meal is $13 , so you can you can buy more than one . Also I think the waiters are friendly and funny . In addition , its is near the university and the downtown area , thats why students eat from it in the break . Finally I strongly believe that the main thing that makes me loce the restaurant is that they sells delicious meat and chicken . In summary all of these reasons let me love to eat this restaurant that let me guve it five stars .

This place is legendary. I am somewhat of a burger coinsure, and I have not found a cooler place with better food yet. This place has been here for a long time, so obviously its  good. Its old fashion yes, but whats wrong with that? And who doesn't like to put their own toppings on, come on! Its very western looking inside, and they have beer. I have no complaints and Ive been going there for about 10 years.
Flame grilled burgers, build your own veggies and sauces and throw in a beer. AWESOME burger place.
great hamburger, Juan is one cool dude, I've been eating there for years, one tip get there about 11:AM for lunch to avoid a long wait, but even if there is a line it's worth it, it moves fast.

So, this was my first time visiting this spot after living in the neighborhood for 2.5 years. I was at a beer festival in downtown Phoenix and really wanted a hearty burger after all of that drinking and light railing it. Since, I run a huge Meetup group that prides itself on supporting local establishments throughout the Valley I decided to check out the Chuck Box to feed my beer filled, yet starving stomach. 

I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger with Swiss Cheese. I am used to Swiss cheese having the wholes in it, but this one did not. I was a little nervous to eat it, but I did, and I am still a live. I am a major foodie and know when things are of great quality, etc. 

Moving on, the burger was damn tasty, in fact kind of hair blowing.  The condiment bar looked a little shady, but once again, I am alive and did not get food poison. The Bacon Cheeseburger came out to be a little over $6.00 just by itself, which to me is kind of pricey for what you get. 

The ambiance is not appealing on the inside, but the outdoor seating looks to be a little nicer. I am happy to have visited this spot, but will not return.

Cheers

Went to Chuck Box after hearing about how awesome the hamburgers were. I really liked the burger and fries(which were awesome) except for the seating area. I would say that they may want to find someone to keep an eye on the tables for cleaning as we had to wipe down our tables with napkins. Not that I am above cleaning but I do enough of that at my house and going out to eat is to get away from all that. So food wise, great, but if I do go again, I may just do take out.

A hole in the wall you'll want to frequent. As a pescetarian, I order the garden burger, and due to the "do it yourself" bar of condiments, I can never go wrong. My boyfriend is a man's man, so he gets the real deal... and we continue to frequent Chuck for a very good reason. So do many others considering the consistent long line regardless of the often long wait ... made to order takes time, kids. I don't recommend the fried zucchini, however, just because it was a bit too cheap tasting and put together. Opt for a different side or create that ranch/hot sauce combo to make anything amazing. One last note, the guac is the consistency of "baby poop" I've been told. We did recommend that they switch the current guac out with a chunkier version. Then again, you might like your guac to have the consistency of mayo. Up to you. At the end of the day, this is a great joint for lunch if you're in the ASU area and looking for a cheap, tasty burger. (They also serve chicken).

Heckled for not having cash. It's 2017! Not sure of why a seemingly established free-standing restaurant only deals in cash. (Hmmmmm...?) Rude dudes behind the line (cooking line). Not very nice. Did not order a thing. Will never return.

Cheap, endless condiments, sitting on wooden crates, smelling like open flame cooked burgers after you leave, the old burlap sacks lining the ceiling, the televisions...

This is a dude establishment. But it's delicious, so it's ok! They even have veggie burgers, but you might be made fun of for ordering one when you could get the huge burger with grilled peppers and bacon on it. Manly!

Real men pay in cash or they don't get food at all.
Burgers done on a grill with a toppings bar.  It was, I believe, cash only at the time I went.  It was very delicious.

Looking for a quick, filling, simple burger near campus? This is the place! 
The best part about this place is that their menu is simple and ordering is really easy. You just tell the guy at the front of the line what you want and he starts making your food. You grab your own drink and after you pay there's an area of toppings so you can put on as much extra stuff as you want. 

I've been coming here since I was a freshman at ASU living in Hassy (freshman dorms on campus) and it hasn't changed at all and is still pretty good. I definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area who wants a simple, delicious burger.

Hands down best burger joint around!!! Great service bomb food affordable price you can't go wrong really. Everything here is great I come here with my son and husband all the time great setting even for families!

The Chuck Box will always have a spot in my heart. As an ASU student in the late '90's it was my go to burger joint on the edge of campus. On a recent visit to Tempe, I was delighted to learn that the place has not changed one bit. It is my all-time favorite burger. These are large fire grilled burgers or chicken, choice of cheese, just stand and watch as your burger grills right in front of you. The dressings come on the bar so you make it to your own taste. It doesn't get any better than this for me. My must visit spot in Tempe, AZ. Love, love, love the Chuck Box. Don't change a thing.

The Chuck Box is pretty pricy for burgers, but it's a piece of Tempe history. It has been around for decades and you are not a true Tempe resident until you have come here. It offers something different with the assembly line style burger customization. The food tastes delicious and the atmosphere is rather pleasant considering it is esentially fast food. Check it out for sure... p.s. my girlfriend wanted me to include that they really hook it up with lots of guacamole (a definite plus).
The food is amazing, do not go there with babies and or little kids. The smoke is overwhelming.

The best burgers in town? Yeah, probably! The Chuck Box has consistently good burgers! I always get a 1/3lb or 1/2 burger and I love that there's a condiment bar so you get to dress your burger to your liking! The only downside is that it's cash only but I suppose you get to make demands like that when you're a staple restaurant!

Chuck box have average price for all people. ASU students can visit chuck box every day. The cheeseburge price is $5. You can add fee any vegetables. The sorbet price is $2. The french fries price is $3. There is special offer any meal by $9.

We were over in Tempe today and it was lunch time.  My wife told me about aplace for a burger that  she used to go to when she was going to school over there.  She built it up a lot so I aid lets go.  Well this time the hype was justified.  One of the  best burgers I have had in recent memory.  We also had the onion rings.  Also worth the trip.  We talked to the cook and he said he had been there for 35 years.  His expertise shows.  I would drive twice as far for a burger that good.
The best burger. They grill them over mesquite in front of your face. Perfect every time. I've been coming here for years. The burgers are awesome.

This place has the best real-deal-this-aint-no-sissy-gourmet burger ive ever had. Its a lofty claim I know, but they can back it up. They also happen to have the fried zucchini that set the bar from which i now judge all other fried zucchini. This joint is no frills and dont expect a hug from the staff but the burger is legit. Definitely put this on your to-eat list yelpers.
Like having a backyard-grilled burger. It's good but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

Whats worse: an ex-con burger flipper who actually barks at you for your order, a filthy condiment bar, cash only, a cashier that walks up and asks you for your drink order and then walks across the restaurant as he goes and clears a table after he just asked you a question, or the fact that if you don't have cash you get to pay an extra $4 on top of your $5-7 burger to use their cute little ATM machine.

I KNOW: the fact that for some reason people completely overlook it all: "If you go to ASU, you have to go to Chuck Box! So good dood."

I was in line, realized I had no cash and began to turn around to go to the ATM up the street. Spatula Master must have noticed that I was about to eff-up his patty streak before his next Skoal break, and shot me that "I'll put 50 wounds into your torso with this Bic pen" look, to which I respond: "I'll be right back" 
And the response I get: "OOOK? Whatever!"

Really? :-O

I would have left, but I was there with friends - damn.

They even have a sign posted claiming that they take cash only because they need to speed up the line. I got an idea: how about you employ more than TWO PEOPLE to service your entire restaurant. No? OK, waste my time and my money instead. I get you. Oh but, that can't be so, not if your website states:

"Besides a cold beer and a burger, I'll be here to greet you with a smile and a hug.
- Big Juan"

Big Juan must've gotten mugged by the two thugs working the grill at burger number 278. Poor Big Juan, I'd probably like this place if he was still around: I was able to make a pretty tasty burger out of a 1/3 lb. on wheat with pepper jack, jalapenos, and onion.

And no, this isn't what it means to be a Hole in the Wall; go up the street to Pollo Supremo: literally nothing but nice Mexican ladies serving you unique and very tasty food for a really good price. Yes they don't take cash, but they don't make excuses, and never would I expect to be greeted with that paint-peeling ex-con death-stare. And whats with the gimmicky Western decor? Hole in the Wall? The closest reason Chuck Box could be categorized Hole in the Wall: I'm afraid to eat here because if I piss off Spatula Master-Burger Nazi, he'll probably grab that red hot grill and flip it over on top of me... you gotta be mildly afraid to eat at a Hole in the Wall...

In all seriousness though, there's no excuse to treat paying customers like they're wasting your time. Maybe people don't know how to react, or they think that somehow its cool to go to Chuck Box and get treated like a roach. 
OOOK? Whatever!

I was very disappointed in this business. No parking. Very poor customer service. I got the big Juan and it was under cooked. The lettuce and tomatoes and extras were all very warm to the touch. Over all very over priced. 

I will not be returning to this establishment.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Chuckbox, been going there for about 6 years, and I still have to maintain that its the BEST burgers I have ever had.  I also and slightly addicted to the fried zucchini.  Yep, its good.  Fresh cooked over an open flame right in front of you, pick your own toppings.  I will usually overestimate the size of my stomach and get a Great Big One, and eat it all. Then 20 mins later, need a nap. Come get the food its great.  PS i like to get a chili pepper on mine, so good.

Went to Chuckbox yesterday with my dad; hadn't been there since the early '90's when I was a student at ASU. I don't think ANYTHING has changed there; and that's a good thing! Still the worlds best burger! Although I can't handle a great big one as easily as I did back in the day! 
I went to Smash Burger for the first time a few weeks ago and it's mighty good. My dad and I decided we had to make a trek back to Chuckbox to decide who has the best burger. We both agreed it's pretty much a tie. Different tasting burgers. VERY different environments; both outstanding!
My dad's comment was that Smashburger tastes 'corporate' and Chuckbox tastes homemade. 
If I had guests from out of town we'd go to Chuckbox every time!
Excellent burger. Charcoal grilled in front of you. Except for cheese you can choose your add ons after leaving the line. This was my first time here and I will be back.
Loved the burgers! good sized meat patty, toasted buns and smothered with extra cheese and bacon. You pay extra for the cheese and bacon but it is well worth it they don't skimp on anything!

Definitely a fun place to check out every once in a while (shouldn't be eating burgers every day anyway).  Food is cooked right in front of you and you can customize any way you want.  Pricing is fair for the quality of meat you're getting.  Their condiment bar has more options than anyone should ever need, but it definitely comes in handy.  You could be ordering the same burger 10 different times and get 10 different experiences out of it.   Very chill environment for the young people to hang out and relax.
My first experience, and I felt like crying when my burger was about to finish. It could be the best burger I've ever had in my entire life. I'm really sad that I'm leaving Tempe in a few days.

This place is literally right across the street from the ASU campus, so I came here quite regularly while I attended there. Every time I come back to visit Tempe, I have to make a stop here. The bacon cheeseburger was my personal favorite. After all, who doesn't love circular bacon? Everything is made right in front of you, it's a lot of fun to watch. One of the trademarks from the cooks is to yell 'FRIES" if you order them. There's a condiment bar where you can put your own stuff on your burger. The Big One is also a popular choice. I loved the BBQ chicken sandwich as well. 

Burgers are very reasonably priced, everything is made to how you want it. They serve beer to wash everything down with as well. It is cash only, but they do have an ATM inside. Parking lot is a little small and it can get very crowded at lunch time. Best to go when ASU is not in session or on the weekends when students are too hungover to go for lunch. But if you're looking for any burgers not named McDonalds or In-N-Out, then this is absolutely the place

I stopped eating beef in 1995 but recently introduced myself to burgers again. My first real chargrilled burger in 19 years was here. It was divine. Perfectly grilled, with American cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles and fry sauce (ketchup and mayo) on a wheat bun. Combo of shrooms and zucchini on the side. It's simple - but that's what makes it so great.
Really cool place. The cook was super nice and the vibe was relaxed. You basically make your own burger, which is always nice. Definitely recommend and the price was cheap.

I'm a very big fan of burgers and take them pretty seriously. This place seems promising but ends up falling short. 
My little sister loves this place because she is young and still prefers cheese burgers with boring toppings... like plain cheese and ketchup. The chuck box makes a good boring burger. They fall short of their topping options. The lettuce, tomato, onion, sauce, ect. are subpar. I believe a good burger needs a good selection of fresh toppings. 

The don't appreciate the value of fresh burger fixings. They would greatly benefit from putting more effort in keeping the fixings fresh.
Spicy chicken sammy, put the cheddar cheese on cold at the end, can't vouch for anything else there.
Must eat more! Love this place! I've been going here for the last seven years! Only down side, the line is to long! But that's a good thing!

Located right next To Arizona State University, Chuck Box has gained a colt following amongst students (And for good reason). In the most convenient expressions: This place is the bee's knees... Simple, Fast, and fresh burgers over an open flame for the right price. A condiment bar,  perfect for personalizing your burger along with superb fries/onion rings makes this joint one of the finest burger spots in town. 
CASH ONLY* so don't whip out the plastic like a rookie. 
Only downside is that you feel like you're in an oven in the summer time, but in the winter it's nice and cozy so dress accordingly either way. I love you Chuck Box. 
Eat well, Live well, and surround yourselves with ones who do.    
 -Cheers
This place is a whole in the wall and had some good food! Its worth the experience and the nice thing is that it's at a reasonable price!

The Chuck Box is a Tempe classic. I love the simplicity of the place and they make great burgers. I always get a classic cheeseburger and their onion rings, which are perfectly crunchy. It can get really busy and seating/parking can be challenging but its worth it.

I love ChuckBox. The quality of the meat and the status it is the place to go in Tempe. 
My own real issue is how busy it is  all the time and the loud atmosphere other than that my burger and onion rings are always good and fresh!
Great burgers, friendly people and terrific atmosphere. The old picture of Reagan in a B movie with a gun tells you immediately that this place has character, and is not afraid to show it.

A couple of friends took me to the Chuck Box for lunch and as soon as we stepped through the doors, the employee across the counter barked at us for our orders. I tried to explain that I've never been there before and didn't know what I wanted but he   was very impatient, and quite frankly rude. We all just picked the first thing we saw just to make this guy stop asking. I would've understood (sorta...) if it was busy but there was absolutely no one in line behind us. When we got our burgers my friend and I were waiting at the cashier for our other friend to get his burger and pay (he was paying for all of ours since we didn't have cash and they accept nothing else.) The cashier asked me who was paying and I pointed behind me and said something to the effect of "the guy waiting for his burger." The cashier shot back, "There's a lot of guys behind you." Dude! It's not like I was trying to skip out on him or anything. I was waiting patiently at the cashiers office (again, with no one behind me) and my friend would be there as soon as his order was ready. It was a really uncomfortable experience and really, some of the worst service I've had. 
The food wasn't anything extraordinary. You put your own toppings on, which were your standard toppings. The fried zucchini were pretty good. The food definitely did not make up for the employees.

I have been coming here for a long time.  You have to be a fan of wood fired grills if you are into burgers.  Since it is not my usual hangout, I always get the "great big one".  You put your own toppings on them after you "check out", so if you do not like certain toppings, it's your choice.  Two minor gripes would be, 1, it is cash only, 2, no free refills on drinks.  What few if any, eateries do not offer free refills?  This won't stop me from coming here, but it does make this place feel "cheap".  Parking is kind of hit and miss too.  Oh well, what do you expect from Tempe?

I was reminded of a backyard BBQ burger. BUT 100 TIMES BETTER!!! The experience was so good! My first time yesterday & I plan to come back again & again. Great service. Great quality tasting food. Nothing like it. The French fries changed me. I definitely recommend The Chuck Box to anyone looking for lunch on any day of the week!

Been going here since I was little.
I love the food and the ambiance.
it's a very small place but I love the condiment bar to allow you to have your food the way you want it. Fresh meat charbroiled goodness!

The popularity of this place defies logic. The best explanation I can think of is the fact that it's been a staple of Tempe for about four decades. But the service is terrible and the burgers are mediocre.

The first time I went here, I thought it was just a bad night for the staff because I had heard such great things. I came here a second time and the staff was just as rude as before and the guy at the grill once again paid no mind to whose order belonged to whom, creating a cluster in the middle of the line of people waiting to get their food. 

The first time I went, my order was wrong. I had to wait another few minutes for the guy to fry the bacon. I assume this is because he gave the other bacon burger to someone else (I saw someone walk away with one just as my oder was supposed to be finishing) because he just doesn't pay attention to any of the customers. The second time I went, another person almost walked off with my food again, but I said that I thought that order belonged to me. Only then did the guy at the grill look up and nod in agreement. Thanks, guy.

Another review here described an employee as "bark(ing)" at him. That seems about right. The cashier is no better. He's curt and doesn't seem to care at all about the fact that there's a line of people who want to give him money. I almost handed him my credit card the second time I went, forgetting that the place is cash only. The cashier gave me a disgusted look and pointed at the cash only sign. I had the cash, but why couldn't I get a simple, "Sorry, we don't accept cards"? Instead, I get the silent treatment and a look that suggests he couldn't care less where I take my business. Message received.

Some people assume if the food is from an independently owned shop, then it's better. Chuck Box proves this is not true. At 40 years old, the establishment has not expanded, probably because there are better options everywhere else you go in Arizona. Even in Tempe, fastfood chains Smashburger and Five Guys both have better burgers. I'm not a big In-N-Out guy, but I'd definitely eat there over Chuck Box. I've even been to McDonald's restaurants with better service than what I've seen here.

If independently owned places are your thing, there are plenty of other options for you in Tempe. Obviously there's Four Peaks. I also recommend Mac's Broiler & Tap at McClintock and Guadalupe. They have a good burger and beer special you can take advantage of and their food is delicious.

If you want a delicious, hot burger with tasty sides, this is your place. It's rustic interior is charming. You get to watch your burger cook. It's not as fast as mcdonalds, but that's a good thing. It's quick and delicious. The fried zucchini were fantastic.
They make a pretty good burger, nothing out of the ordinary. Onion rings are very good, and the atmosphere is kind of cool.

Amazing burgers; like backyard bbq amazing!  ...and awesome fries, too.  Huge condiment bar -- but don't go if you're a germ freak or pay for everything in life with plastic:  This place isn't for you.  No fancy seating or bright lights -- it's tiny, you sit on old logs and there's usually a line -- but don't worry, it's worth the wait.  No "product uniformity" here, but who cares -- they're damn good!

Charbroiled wonderfulness right at ASU. This place makes the best classic style charbroiled burger in town. Get in the line (it moves quickly), look up at the board to decide what you want, and be ready early because they'll ask you in order to get it started and move things along quickly. After you've paid you get to dress up you burger to your wishes at the full condiment bar. Good experience for kids too. So, bring your CASH and hope for a free parking spot in their own small lot (or pay across the street).
A charcoal grilled burger and a pitcher of beer? Yes, please. The buns are just supermarket buns and the fries and onion rings are previously frozen, but I like this place a lot for lunch.

Awesome burgers! Friendly staff, nice old school look to it and fast service. Love this place! My friend brought me here to try out the burgers and have been hooked since!  If you are out in Tempe and want to try some great burgers and fries come to this place, trust me is worth it and the price is pretty good too!
Man this place is a dirty pit ran by ex-con's. the food is tasty but eat it at your own risk....

My dad used to take us here all the time and now that im a student at asu I love coming here for the great memories and food, the veggie burger is great! No frills here and the fries could stand to be better but I will always love this place :)
Loved this lil local dive!!  AMAZING burger and nice cold beer!

Hands down the best place to get a burger in Tempe. This place pwns in and out and five guys. I usually get the big one, but have fucked around with the tijauno torpedo, as well as the great big one (too much meat for my taste). They also have great appetizers (mushrooms, and onion rings), but tend to avoid the fries. The wings here are unique, worth a try, but stick with the burgers.

I enjoyed the char grilled burgers here very much. The meat is fresh when placed on the grill. Once your burger is cooked, you put all the side on (as little or as much as you want). 

Fries are good, but not great.

Has a relaxed atmosphere. The place always is busy when I go or drive by.

If you like long waits and sweating your a$$ off then go here. I have no idea if the food is good, I left because I couldn't handle the heat.  No AC??!! Come on guys it is Phoenix. I get the "we take cash only", too cool for school mentality but why torture your patrons?

This place has some of the best burgers in the entire Phoenix area. I love the fact that the burgers are fresh and grilled right in front of you on the giant wood grill. The flavor that the grill adds is excellent! The decor is simple and to the point with a very rustic feel. The staff is friendly and they have a giant "build your own" salad and toppings bar. If I had to nit pick one thing it would be that the fries are just OK. Just keep in mind that it is cash only. So if you are looking for a good fresh burger, check out Chuck Box.
Amazing burgers that will leave you wanting to come back! Juicy, charbroiled goodness that melts in your mouth. The onion rings are fresh and some of the best i have ever had.

This is one of the classic burger joints in Phoenix. Just walk up to the grill and place your order. The Big One is the standard but get the The Great Big One if you're really hungry. Slide on over to the left and grab a drink. Then just be patient and they'll have your burger ready in a minute. Slide over to the left again and you can grab a fry. Then time to pay--cash only, mind you. Now the beauty of the process is the condiments bar. You can make as simple or complex of a burger as you want. Nothin fancy, just a burger done exceptionally well.

I miss the second location they had in Scottsdale on Scottsdale and Shea. An Oreganos replaced it years ago and I still hold an irrational grudge against that establishment.

Everytime we go to the Phoenix Zoo (28 miles) we look forward to feeding our faces at the Chuck Box. Sure it's a little different with ordering also with the same rustic atmosphere from the first day they opened. Whats great you can see your food being cooked in front of you. Nostalgic for a 1973 ASU Alumni we've been going there since it opened and nothing's changed. Which is great for us.
They have the best barbecued hamburger, actually all the food there is great. Lov it.
The line can be long but they get you thru it quickly, bring CASH to save you the chance of having to use the ATM machine. 
I don't mind the cash part especially when the food is good also having the rustic atmosphere makes it pleasant.

I love the Chuckbox.  Juan, great tasty burgers, great ASU Co-Eds, condiment bar, onion rings, etc etc etc.

I have never had a bad experience there.  When working off of Priest a few years back, a group of us would go weekly.  Can't miss.
Best burger around. This is like grilling at home but without the work! Try the torpedo!

Love this place! The only down side is they charge for water, or at least they charged us when we got water and we told the guy we got water. Overall, food is awesome, environment is awesome, the little burger bar where you can decorate your burger is awesome. Keep it up guys. :) Get the half n' half on the fried mushrooms and zucchini, yum! I also love the prices for everything.
First time having this place & they were great! It was at least a 15 minute wait for my chicken breast to be done but I'd rather have it cooked than to get sick from it. Plus the chefs were friendly

Food was great! I don't normally review but I had a not so great experience the cook Anthony was very rude to my family and it just ruined our whole experience the cashier Mike was nice and tried making everything better for us. Overall food made up for it though...

One word:  Awesome!!
If you've never ate  a burger at the Chuck Box, then you haven't really had the best burger ever made, period....

Its a must for me to eat here once more before I leave  Az.

This is a traditional stop with my Daddy on my way into town for a visit. Tucked into its spot on ASU's campus, you could totally pass up this place if not for the heavenly smells and the crowd lined up out the door. The cooked to order burgers, chicken and sides are heaven on an open flame. Great toppings bar and a cold beer to boot, this is a great value for the money. Be sure to bring your money too. Cash money, no exceptions and there is an ATM inside. 

Get there ASAP.

You have probably driven past this joint a dozen times without even thinking about it.  Next time, make the stop.

The Mustache loves a good greasy spoon, and this is a prime example.  It's a tiny shack with a charcoal fire roaring at one end.  A condiment counter sits in the center of an eating area that is little more than boxes turned sideways for sitting, and tables left with "gifts" from the folks who sat there previously.  You see, the place gets so busy with seats at such a premium that there isn't time for staff to clean tables in between when folks leave and you sit down.

The burgers are juicy and flavorful, with that "dusty" charcoal flavor incorporated within them.  The buns are thick and over-the-counter, probably Aunt Hattie's or similar.  Fries are tasty and thrown at you piping hot.  There are also options like fried zucchini or fried mushrooms, but who wants vegetables?!

This brings up a pair of side points...vegetarian options are a no-go here.  There are plenty of places in Tempe that will offer vegetarian or vegan meals, this should not be seen as one of them.  In related health news, the smoke from the charcoal pit frequently overwhelms the smoke-ejection system and backs up into the restaurant itself.  If you have respiratory problems or are otherwise fearful of breathing in occasionally-thick barbecue smoke, you can choose outdoor eating or just take your food to go.  A member of my party reported stinging eyes from the smoke, though to me it just felt like a fun backyard barbecue with all of the smoky aromas included.

The ordering process is old-school.  You enter and immediately form a line to your right, which snakes in front of the cooking area.  Your order is shouted at whomever is behind the counter, he in turn shouts it to the cook, who shouts something back to him, he then shouts to you to walk to the register and stop holding up the line.  Yeah, it's a bit daunting for a newbie.  All the shouting and confusion take you back to your first baseball practice as a child.

You'll quickly snap out of it at the register, where you'll pay in cash and then go about the business of finding a seat.  At lunchtime, this is a very difficult task.  Note that seats by the door offer you better ventilation from the aforementioned smoke problem, but will crowd you with folks lining up to order their food.  Condiments are sitting at a central counter, you can load up on them to your palate's delight.

Fifteen minutes later you are fat and happy, and your arteries are begging for mercy.  But that's what a good burger joint is all about, isn't it?
Pretty solid burger, cash only. I think it is slightly overrated because it seems to have a cult like status in Tempe while they are pretty good burgers, I don't think they are as good as their rep.

This place is an ASU and Tempe tradition.  Cash only.  The burgers are good and you get to see them grill your burger and toast the buns inside the shop.  Awesome atmosphere and friendly service.  If your around ASU check out the Chuck Box.
I don't normally give five stars. But this place deserves it. Best burger ever. Draft root beer was delicious too. I'll be back often.

Cool place, found it by accident was driving down the street and was hit with this hickory smoke coming from this little joint and pulled in and have been going ever since. Burgers are always good, price is great and the poppers are always crispy.
Excellent! Best burger in Tempe. Bring cash, no credit cards here. Fast, delicious and fresh
Awesome burger joint.  A must when visiting ASU.

Was told about this place when I worked in Tempe.  Everyone raved about it.  Went and felt like I was at a Fudruckers.   Was overall disappointed in my experience.  Burger was ok.  Maybe just an off day?

Three stars all for the burgers. Reminiscent of the original Dairy Queen (from 20+ years ago). Flame broiled burgers. Just plain good. None of the fried sides are necessary. Go big with your burger and pile on the condiments from the craaaaaaaaaazy salad bar!  Side note- the chairs are just wooden crates.

Of all the burger places in town, this is one of the best ones, if not the best one.  It is usually packed.  The burgers are always cooked consistently.  The best thing about this place is the toppings bar, you can make it exactly how you want it.

I used to eat at the Chuckbox when I went to school at ASU and loved it. Years later and after living in Texas and California, I still haven't found a burger that compares to it.

That is, as long as you accept it for what it is: a straight, non-fancy-pants burger on a charcoal grill. The way a burger should be. If you want a fauxbe-beef burger with truffle oil and scallions, you're in the wrong place. If you're easily put off by being shouted at while you dilly-dally about what kind of cheese you want, you're also in the wrong place. 

And, while you while you wait for your burger by the grill, you can pass the time by trying to decipher the code of little swords and cups that identifies an order. It's pretty complex.
The buns were bought from a place like costco. The fixin bar was limited. The tomato was cold and therefore had no flavor. The meat tasted good.

What?! Are you freakin kidding me?! You never ate at The Chuck Box???!!!! They only take cash cuz they get so much business they don't need your stinkin' credit card!  They didn't spend money on comfortable seating cuz they know that your not going to give a f#@$ as soon as you start eating... Best burger!  Get the big one with bacon on it.  Oh yea this place is nice.

Probably the best burger in the valley. Not a fancy diner so this was right up my alley.  They have a pretty good selections to choose from (beef - chicken) and assortment of deep fried foods, of course. I usually go for the double with american and onion rings. But their fried mushrooms and equally amazing. Bring cash. No CC accepted here.

Arguably the best, freshest burgers in town. Staff is always friendly and food is always good. Probably my only complaint is that it's pretty small inside- but hey, the small cozy wooden ambiance is what adds to the experience. Tastes like burgers at at back-yard BBQ.

5 stars if it weren't cash only.
Fantastic burgers, great onion rings.  This is my go to spot in Tempe.
Place is old and dingy with a unique historical feel but I'm not there for the atmosphere. Overall, one of the best burgers you can get in Tempe.

Good burger. Made to order right on the charcoal grill. You select your patty size and type of cheese.  Customize your own burger with basic condiments.  Add fries and a drink.

Customer service, nonexistent. The cashier didn't even say thank you when I handed him a tip.

The store itself was hot and muggy. It felt like it was hotter inside than outside, and outside was over 104 degrees!

Overall, a decent burger but not worth it.

A hole in the wall atmosphere. Cash only. Friendly and efficient staff. We had the torpedo and little along with fries and onion rings. Everything was delicious beyond my expectations. They cook on what looks like a sewer grate over charcoal. REAL beef; Not frozen patties! Self serve bar for all the condiments and fixins. The line moved fast despite the large crowd.

Being a pescetarian,  my options were extremely limited,  yet as you see, I gave this place 5 stars.  If any smell is gonna get me to eat meat after 5 years, it's the smell of Chux. No frills. All old school, making cheap food taste amazing. Doing a great job, Chux. Keep it up, & I'll keep coming back.

Not a big fan of burgers but I loved this place.
I like how MANLY this place seems to be, if you want some burgers cooked by some real men, this is where you go. The people who cook it seem like they just came out from prison, I love it. 
The only down side is that you have to have cash but with burgers like these, who cares?
Great burger joint. Not a high class place more like a real low key burger place that cooks your burger in front of you with yummy sides. Has a condiment bar as well.

The time finally came to try Chuck Box. It was definitely worth the wait. First off, the burgers are the only credibility to this business. The rest (side orders) are average. Burgers are very good, and may taste unique in a way. I've tasted so many char-grilled burgers, I have lost count. However, CB's burgers are on top. Some times they over make fries and need to get rid of them. You will see one of the workers walking around offering customers fresh fries...like whaaaatttt? :)

Only downsides are this place only accepts CASH. Also, inside seating may be limited when busy.

this place has a couple of great things working for it:
- pretty original place with some character... sometimes hard to find around ASU...
- tasty burgers
- condiment bar
- simple ordering process
- decent seating indoors, even some outdoors for the few days of un-hellish heat.

for these same reasons, i think it's got a couple of things working against it:
- it's across the street from a college, and it's not college-kid prices for those of us that dont have daddy's dime.
- cash only is not very convenient when you need a bite between classes.

Excellent food, fast, and cheap! The burgers are freshly grilled at order. You can put whatever you want on it. The building is small, but has been there a while. Not a ton of seating inside, but lots of outdoor tables. Even if there is a line out the door, it does not take long! Fun place to go and visit. Definitely should go if you are a visitor!

Chuck Box is awesome. Its cheap and the burgers and chicken are great.  Indoor and outdoor seating in a sort of log cabin/ farm house setting, cooked to order, condiment bar, very relaxed atmosphere.  If i lived close enough i would totally walk here hungover in PJs with my hair fro-ing to get some grub and feel totally fine about it.  Only down side is i dont think they serve alcohol, but who needs booze when you have heaven on a bun, huh?

My favorite memory of the chuck box is watching a group come in and sit down at a table, getting huffy when no one brought them a menu. I wanted to tell them they need to go stand in line an order their food, but they looked like mean tempered stuck up snobs so I sat an enjoyed my mesquite charcoal grilled burger and watched them huff and puff about bad service before they got up and walked out. 

If you're a person that likes to be cuddled and kissed up to just because you ordered food, this isn't the place for you. 

If shouting your order to the order taker, over a crowd of people in line frightens you, this is not the place for you. 

If you somehow thought eating a chuck box burger would bring inner peace or some semblance of meaning to your pathetic life, this is not the place for you.

If you want a simple burger, cooked the way you cook it in your backyard or out camping, and you're not afraid to assemble your own toppings, and you're just as comfortable sitting on a wooden box as you're sitting on a stack of tires or a log, this place is for you.
One of the best burgers in Phoenix.Charcoal grilled and great fixin selections to suite individual taste.Beware...cash only!
Awesome Burger and great service, do it yourself. Great lunch place before the Cactus Bowl.  Go Dawgs.

You're not really going to ASU unless you go to Chuck box at least once. It's as part of the campus as the MU or Gammage. The food is amazing, 100% delicious. I've had people recommend the veggie burger, the big one, the chicken, but i love love love the hotdog. I seriously can't get enough backdoor BBQ but in the winter that's incredibly difficult to come by. Unless you know about the Chuck box. If this place doesn't give you the warm fuzzy feeling of summer and the forth of July grilling, nothing will.

Beware, they only except cash, and the line is very difficult to get into from the east door. The seats are uncomfortable, the other customers are awful, and the busy times last for hours upon hours, but it's all worth it, I promise. I would wait three hours for a roller coaster, and I would wait four hours for the food at this place. Enjoy!

This place is amazing!  I went to ASU and it was the best then and 10 years later they still have the best burgers in town!  Now I share it with my kids who love when we go there.  If you try all the chain burgers, then you are missing out by not trying the chuck box

I almost always have the garden burger, which is not cooked on any meatless portion of the grill--but that's not what Chuckbox is about. At least they offer a garden burger. The jalapeno poppers and fries are great.

Once you grab your burger and drink, you pay, then head over to the fixin' bar.

Be aware that it's cash only, but if you forget, you pay the price at the onsite ATM.

Ever wonder why a place that doesn't have seafood has a warning that the food served may contain shellfish products? I do! Just a question to ponder while you what in a long line for a juicy burger at this no-frills eatery.  We showed up on a beautiful Friday, so of course there was a mad rush. Unfortunately, there was no free parking available, so I paid for parking across the street at the ASU lot.

After walking up to order a bacon burger and fries, we got lunch served on a paper plate, like you would at a family BBQ or picnic grill. Seriously, it's no frills. Then, you head over to the condiment bar to get your own lettuce, tomatoes, ketchup, onion, etc. Just like if you were at a family BBQ. Noticing a trend?  Now, find a place to sit, but warning, it might be sticky!

On to the food: the burger was juicy, and had good flavor, but the bun was TERRIBLE. Grocery-store-white-bread-soggy-in-10-seconds, wait, the kind that you get at a family BBQ, bun.  Toppings were acceptable, not exceptional.  Fries were decent.  You gotta eat pretty fast before the sandwich falls apart.

Pros: juicy burger.
Cons: bad bun. 

Come here if you miss your family BBQ! And what is up with that food allergy warning?

The Chuckbox brings to the table what is possibly the best burger in Tempe. If you take In-N-Out out of the picture, this burger is uncontested as the tastiest burger. They have a simple menu that consists of different sized meats, cheeses and different appetizers (such as fried mushrooms). Their burgers are freshly cooked in front of you and their fries are absolutely delicious. They have a toppings station where they have burger toppings as well as dipping sauces and condiments. Their seating is similar to that of a cabin (very cozy though). As far as service, I've always gotten exceptionally good service (except for one time around two years ago). Very friendly staff and very professional at what they do. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a really good burger in Tempe.

The best burger joint in the valley!
Double Big Juan w/cheese and a side of fries.
You will love this place.

I am for Chuck box  being a great place. First of all . In my opinion I Believe that chuck box is a great place for lunch and dinner , because a lot of families are happy when they are at chuck box second , the chuck box is off campus it's near to ASU. Third , the quality of service is good and staff at chuck box is so friendly . Finally , for there reasons I think chuck box is good place to eat . :)

The absolute best burger in Arizona. When I was in college, I couldn't afford to eat here 3 times a week but I did because it was that good. If I am going to be anywhere near there I detour over for a burger. Love the Chuckbox!
I'm sure glad I discovered this little bit of paradise.  Great chile; great wings; great burgers; and reasonable prices.  I'm taking my daughter there tomorrow!!!

Food wise if you like burgers then these guys are a solid 5. Everything else 3. 

Went for the first time today with some co-workers. Long lunch crowd, not a fan of the guy taking orders yelling asking people in the long line for their order and I had to yell back before anyone actually got to the front, I had no idea what they offered and would have felt embarrassed if I hadn't been given a paper menu by a co-worker so I could order right away. 

The place was warm, humid, my seat was a wooden box that was planted to the ground sideways so I wasn't able to move my feet very easily with the small space under the table. I'm not a fan of self serve topping section, reminds me of a smaller less air conditioned Fuddruckers except they don't have Buffalo or ostrich burgers for me to try.  

They don't take cash...come on, why make people borrow from friends or pay an atm fee(my friend said their bank reimburses them). I'm curious if chuck box pockets the $2 charge in addition to saving the credit fees. They're clearly not hurting for business and they don't have a dollar menu so  just suck it up and pay the 15 cents for every $5 burger you sell for customer convince. 

I don't normally pay $5.50 for a burger (over $8 with fries and tax) but they're burger was very good, their fries were great too. 

There are many, MANY places to eat around ASU and if I feel like paying 8 bucks for lunch again I'll try more places I haven't been before I come here again.

The flame broiled burgers are awesome. There are no actual chairs to sit on, only wooden boxes. This of course adds to the western chuckbox theme and charm of the place. 

My only gripes are that there are no refills on drinks and there is a condiment bar that was pretty messy which led me to believe that it isn't attended to as frequently as it should be. Also, the condiment bar uses cheap picnic plastic ware that could easily fall into the product... Not very sanitary. Being that this place appears constantly busy, I'm sure it's not easy to keep the patrons from trashing it. 

Those are the only issues I had which would have otherwise netted The Chuck Box five stars.  I would still recommend this warm and homey little joint to my friends. :) 

Like I had stated: The food is awesome and the staff are friendly and accommodating. A definite place to go if you want a real burger done right!

City of Tempe and its residents should be excited to have this place around! 

Awesome burgers and fries, wine or beer on tap, help-yourself condiments bar, chill atmosphere, indoor and outdoor seating, super affordable prices that are specifically designed for small budgets (college students), great service, etc.

The only con is that it's on cash only basis but they have an ATM machine inside.
Yummy burgers and fries! But they don't accept credit so make sure you bring cash so you don't have to pay those stingy ATM fees!

The Chuckbox is a good hole in the wall place to eat. Really good burger. It was my first time hear and they impressed me. It was a nice good cooked burger right over the grill and you could taste the freshness of the burger.

First dined here in 1973 as an ASU freshman. Nothing has really changed and never should. A throwback in time. Flame grilled burgers right in front of you, hot and crispy fries and an awesome fresh condiment bar. Bring cash, no credit cards. My fave is a Big One with cheese. Over 278 sold

I love this place, but every time I go the service seems to get worse. I know the Chuckbox isn't known for its friendliness but  lately their servers seem to just be annoyed at their jobs. Twice I have clearly ordered BBQ chicken and I was given a buffalo sauce. It's fun to go once or twice but it's pretty expensive. Sometimes the condiments look ok, sometimes they look pretty gross.

I'm really surprised I forgot to review this place when I ate here some months ago.
I doubt anything has changed.
WOOD COAL flame grilled burgers made to order right in front of you, condiment bar, and beer available. It is unknown whether beer choices have improved over the standard yellow piss. Someone message me.

Rustic and dingy atmosphere, and spartan seating.
Please DO NOT be turned off by this.
You're here for an AUTHENTIC flame-grilled burger.
You top your burger how you want!
Order it medium.
Absolutely scrumptious burger.
Juicy.
Smokey.
TOTALLY REAL.
You can't get any more real.

THAT IS ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW.
Except CASH ONLY.

Although I went to high school out in Tempe, I never attended ASU or went to this esteemed spot. Remember if you visit the Chuck Box, they only accept cash! Now if you're looking for an amazing char grilled burger, this is the hottest spot near Mill! The burger was tender and juicy, with the meat seared to perfection on the char set up! The size is hefty and it is cooked to perfection on the flame. As a burger afficionado, this was definitely up there as one of the best! Beware of the long lines and wait, but the food is totally worth it! The fries were awesome as well! I had friends driving through AZ from another state and they agreed that the burger was spectacular. Chuck Box you win! Just wished I visited this place sometime earlier in the last 10 years during my time in Tempe!

This place is a Arizona Establishment. My dad would tell me stories of studying in the 70s here. 
We went back for burgers and he told me it hadn't changed a bit.

A few mentions:
#1 Cash only establishment.
#2 Open Bar condiments. 
#3 Know your order BEFORE you get into line.
#4 Nobody will ask you if you want it "To-Go". You do it when you order.
If you don't think you can handle those things. Don't come. You will hate it regardless of how amazing the food is. 

This is an old school- make it when you order it, cafeteria style (but quite clean), no frills, nobody holding your hand - burger joint. Burgers are big with no fillers. Staff will take no guff from you or apologize for your mistake. Condiments are fresh (their pickles are amazing!) Onion rings the best (Beer battered). Beers are cheap. Prices are low. Bus your own tables.

Love the concept and the back to basics nature, problem was the burgers had no flavor, everything was good, it just lacked the flavor, the beef didn't have it and the bacon didn't either. Fries and mushrooms were good and the burger as a whole was good, but lacking flavor and the congestion of people moving backward and forward in life made hinge difficult. 80/20 ratio would be a better tasting burger, will come back!

Finally I have found a great hamburger place!! I suggest adding the green chili (adds flavor without the heat). If you are really hungry go for the 1/2 lb as you may still be hungry after with the 1/3 lb. CASH ONLY.
I went here last Saturday night. My first time. I have to admit, the burgers are among my top 5. Amazing!  I shall definitely be returning and am more than happy to recommend them.

I really like coming here, everything is always superb! The hamburgers are quite large, and the dressings they provide on the condiment table are very nice. The onion rings and fries are nice and crispy, and cooked to order, just like everything else. I love the toothpick system the hamburger chef has for knowing which cheeses and toppings to put with which patties. Trying to decipher it keeps me entertained while waiting in line.

Hot dogs are just okay, they slice them in half and grill them like burgers, even serve them on a burger bun! I usually just stick with the hamburger, even the lil one is enough for me.

I've been here many times as I used to work across the street from '78 - '84. The food was much better back then. Hadn't been in for quite awhile, so I came in on a Sunday at 10:40 am. It was fairly busy, and the wait standing in front of the grill is BS! They need to change their system. I had a double great big one with cheese, to go. Unfortunately my burger which I ordered medium rare was close to medium well. Totally brown, and on the dry side. I can make a better burger at home for the same $$ I paid here. I despise overcooked burgers, so I will not be returning as it is really nothing special in the first place.
Always delicious!! Definitely would recommend anyone to at least give it a try. Yummy. Also would recommend not "over doing it" with the condiments because the burger itself is flavorful
My favorite burger joint in Tempe, cash only but worth every cent. I'd recommend adding the green chili to your meal.

I must be missing something... Just not my kind of place I guess.  Other than having close proximity to ASU, I have no idea how this place stays in business. Definitely, not a place to sit down comfortably (chairs are actually Woden crates sitting on their sides) and relax on your lunch hour. Extremely loud and everyone is fighting for a spot at the Condiment bar to add some sort of flavor to a low end meat burger. I've also had better fries at Wendy's and McD's...With Portillo's a mile and a half away, why would anyone go back here?
This review will remain a 1-star until you quit being lazy and accept other, less antiquated forms of payment than cash. Get with the times.

This place rates stars for just being cool.  The building is small, dressed in plank wood like a shack.  Even the name is cool.  I love places like this, never daring to pretend they are something they're not.  It's a burger grill.  There are several tables in there but most of the room is dedicated to the big a** grill and the toppings bar.  Their line system is efficient since you fix up your own toppings and their menu is simple.  The service is friendly but not over-done.  Like the reviews here say, this is not a place for truffle oil, bacon jam or broccoli rabe.  It's just burgers lovingly crafted on a grill.  This is one of the places you take your co-worker from out of town to show them that one Arizona hole-in-the-wall which will make them envy you when they leave.
The food here at The Chuck Box is really good and delicious.The burgers here are delicious and so are the fries.And I love the history here about The Chuck Box

This place is great. Wow. I love meat and burgers and hearty food. Got the bacon cheese burger and man was I impressed. The bacon was circular and flat instead of strips, it was a nice touch. Try it for yourself.

Awesome!! I go to this place every time I'm in Tempe. It's a bbq indoors! Made to order chicken, burgers, or hotdogs. Laid back atmosphere but bring cash. They don't accept credit cards. Top your food the way you like with as much as you like.
What  a cool place... CASH ONLY but the prices are good and the burgers are fantastic!

My favorite burger joint easily. I highly recommend their original burger the "big one" or their "hot 'n' spicy chicken". Everything I've had here has been delicious. The food is cooked over an open flame while you watch. The place is always packed, so I recommend going either for an early lunch or late lunch to avoid the crowd. Its cash only, so plan ahead and bring cash. There is an ATM, but there's an ATM fee, so its better to just bring cash.

update:
If you've never been, this place, GO. Its rustic/cowboy themed. You walk in, shout your order over a noisy crowd packed in the small building. Then watch your food get cooked over a wood burning fire. Once you pay (with cash), then you can pile on toppings at the self-serve toppings bar. There's indoor and outdoor seating. Also, there is beer on tap and free soda refills.

This is the ONE restaurant that I frequent that has never disappointed me, even in the slightest way.

I really like this place. Its a very basic burger and fry place. It can get backed up because of the way the line is set up and the soda machine is in a really poorly chosen spot. They only take cash which is kind of annoying.


Good burger

good fries

good onions rings

A veritable Tempe establishment. Whenever I tell my dental hygienist I go to ASU, she asks me if I've been to the Chuckbox.

Sometimes, you just want a simple burger with no frills. No floofy brioche bun with sundried tomatoes and blah blah blah. The meat has great flavor from the charcoal and mesquite and you can get a 1/3 lb Big Juan and still have change from a 5.

And the condiment bar is fantastic. I can put tons of tomatoes just because I want to and there's lettuce, onions, and ranch dressing too so you can make your own little side salad. 

Now there's lots of other options by ASU like smashburger, five guys, fatburger, etc, but when I have a hankering for a good burger, Chuckbox is the place to go.

Don't want to wait for a waiter, then The Chuck Box is the place for you as long as you don't mind a line.  To order you queue up in a line by the front door where a gentleman will take your order from their simple, yet good menu hanging overhead. You then walk cafeteria style to the end of the grill where you pick up your tray of food and pay. This makes for a great in and out style of eating while getting higher quality food than take out.  From my experience I would say they have good burgers and fries.  I also love their chicken strips as long as they don't come back over done.  Last recommendation is the fried zucchini.  Hope you enjoy!

It's probably obvious but this place is by no stretch healthy food so if you were looking for a healthy meal or a veg/special diet friendly place the Chop Shop next door might be a better bet. 

That being said this is by far my favorite burger place (and maybe restaurant) in town. The atmosphere is awesome: cooks shouting orders and smells from the grill right in front of you. Even the hungry patrons in line are in a great mood, we always seem to make friends with the people in line. Despite the rustic feel and run down look the place is always surprisingly clean and tables are cleared right away to make room for the piles of people that come in. 

Now the important part: the food. Burgers grilled right in front of you are all cooked the same way, to perfection. I highly recommend adding bacon (and cheese of course) to whatever burger you order. The fries are great and the onion rings are better. We usually get one of each and split. The burgers don't look that huge but they are very filling. 

Draft root beer and beer both come with mason jar mugs and are a great bonus to this guilty pleasure meal. You haven't really experienced the best of Tempe without coming to the Chuck Box!

Awesome great burger!! I ordered a double cheeseburger and my wife had a single with melted cheddar cheese and it was off the chain!!! The bread was on point and all the fixings were available on a table after you order. My wife got the chili cheese fries that I wasn't too thrilled about because they had beans in the chili, so overall the service was great and a good time to go is after the lunch crowd. I will be back for more....this is the best burger I have had in years!

The guy cooking was super friendly. The guy checking us out was so rude. Fries that were sitting on the counter before we got there was being served to us, when asked for fresh fries the guy said "what am I going to give the guys behind you?" I was shocked! The place had flies buzzing around and the burger had a diapery taste. Nasty place, I will never go back.

After hearing many good things I decided to stop by Chuck Box.

It lost points with me right when I walked in, "Cash only".  They have atms inside but they require a surcharge which annoys me.

I ordered the big juan (1/3 lb burger) with a side of onion rings.

While I was waiting for my food I noticed the topping bar, consisting of your typical burger toppings.  This is a nice plus because you can really have it how you want it.

I got my food fairly quick after watching them grill my burger in front of me.

After i got my cheeseburger, I put lettuce, tomato, onions, mayo and jalapenos.  I took my first bite and thought it was very good.  However my second bite I noticed it wasn't quite as good.  My third it was very average.  By my forth bite I was tired of it.  I don't know what it was but it just did not taste that special to me.  The meat itself just did not taste great.

Also the onion rings were very average.  Not bad but not sure if I would recommend them.

Overall my first experience at the Chuck Box was a bit of a disappointment.

I came in with people hyping this place up so much with one person even saying "best burger ever eaten."

Maybe I came in with too high of expectations.  Maybe I just came in on a bad day.  Maybe its just not my place.

Overall Chuck Box was not bad, but I do not understand all the hype.

A   v  e  r  y   tasty burger!

Yes, at the chuck box I expected very little but got a different friday lunch experience, thats for sure. Yes, it is odd that one shouts ones order over a line of waiting patrons to the loud chef in the kitchen - but that just add to the experience.
 
Weird - a bit
Unorthodox - absolutely
Wrong - not at all

Then after joining the crowd of hungry, waiting customers I start to checking out the place. Red hot fire that the burgers all are braised over makes it kinda genuine in a way. A bar in the centre with all condiments and fixings, is up for grabs once the correct burger has been fetched and paid for. 

As I stated initially, I got myself a very tasty burger and a small serving of very tasty onion rings. It was Friday, so I'm allowed to.

I even liked the crates that substitutes for chairs and makes sure that as long as you are here, you are here to eat. There was a few things that could been improved, (and the ill manner isn't one of them) but overall I really enjoyed the chuck box and I will come back. Oh yes, I will come back.

The charcoal grill gave it such an amazing flavor! We got the Tijuana Torpedo with pepper jack cheese and whole green chilies. It's so fresh, and I love the toppings bar too. It makes it much more customizable. Cute atmosphere as well!

The condiments bar was fresh and delicious. The service was ok. The food was not bad. I actually enjoyed the chicken breast. The burger wasn't as great as hyped. It was ok. I think the expectation had been set so high that I left full, but disappointed. CASH only kind of sucked, I mean who does that anymore? I've definitely had better burgers and been to better restaurants within walking distance of this place. I don't know if I'll give it another try? Too many options nearby.
Best burger in Arizona, bar none. Unique setting as well, very plain and rustic.

A Tempe favorite for decades... My favorite burger is the Tijuana Torpedo but ALL of their burgers are awesome and are grilled while you wait. Cash only and please be ready to order when you get in line. Once you get your burger, you can go to the huge condiment bar and customize it how ever you want.
The Chuck Box  is a true Tempe institution and you will not be disappointed. :)

Place is rustic and old,  not a bad thing since it is thematic of the restaurant itself. I have no problem with old but dirty is a different story. I must have come in before the annual mopping because the floor was... greasy. A burger and fries came out to be 7.68 or so, a drink would've pushed it to 10. For that money I could go to In n out and get a better burger, fries and drink for 2 people. While the wood fire grill is a unique touch, the burgers are thin and lacking.  I came here under the pretense that this place would have juicy, thick ground Chuck steak patties.  Not the case.  Fries sat under a heat lamp and were dry inside and out,  dusted in Salt.  I will not be back.

If your just looking for a GOOOOD BURGER then this is your spot. Nice selection of burgers to choose from. I took off one star because the place was a little warm in the summer but I really like all that smokey goodness. Its a must stop when I'm back in town.

Made a stop here before the ASU U of A game on Saturday. 

Food was fine nothing over the top but very solid. They did a great job of keeping the line moving as there were a lot of people there picking up food before the game.

Really good food.  Kinda like being at a campfire type of a feel.  We always get the big one with the beer battered onion rings.  The onion rings are a must.  Forget the fries though (frys are just eh) and try fried zucchini instead.
The best burgers and chicken sandwiches you will ever eat. You can't make one of these burgers at home.

The burgers are amazing. I got the John Wayne with hot sauce and it was AMAZING! The hot sauce brings out the flavor without killing the taste with unnecessary heat. I did not order fries, but I did get a pitcher of beer. The beer was ice cold. 

For a person going there for the first time I would recommend looking at the menu ahead of time. They take orders really quick and you need to be ready to order almost right away. Expect a line, but it moves pretty quickly.  They have a toppings bar for your burgers or chicken sandwiches

Saw this shack of a dilapidated-looking "house" and wondered what it was.  As I came closer, I saw what appeared to be outdoor tables with tree stumps as seating.  Went in and low and behold---a burger place.  Better yet, I could see some great looking burgers cooking on a fire grill. Even better yet, the wood fired grill uses mesquite wood!  We ordered two burgers with fries which were cooked perfectly (rare is hard to get as most restaurants are afraid to serve rare meat).  A condiments bar includes lettuce, tomato, jalapeos, pickles, sweet onions,as well as the usual toppings of mustard, ketchup, etc.  We topped our burgers and ate one of the most delicious burgers we have ever had.  The fries were perfectly fried (I asked for extra well done) and salted.  I can't tell you how great the burger was!   They are open 7 days a week which means... I will be there again soon.    
BTW:  This is a CASH ONLY place.  Fine by me.

As a former ASU Kid, this place was a staple in my diet. The smell is amazing and if you happen to study close by it can easily creep into your classroom. There's always a wait and it's sometimes difficult to get a seat but well worth it. The burgers are a make your own when it comes to condiments, may not seem too spectacular but wait until you bite into one of these mouth-watering gifts from heaven! Anything on the meu is good but two of my favorites are their fried zucchini and fried mushrooms, not the healthiest restaurant out there but well worth it for anyone visiting Tempe and ASU.
If your ever in Tempe Az this is a must. Cash only but awesome little hole in the wall restaurant.

If only the Board of Regents knew what a powerful incentive they had at their disposal in attracting students to Arizona's largest state university.

I like to say that the Chuckbox was one of the main reasons I went to ASU. Although I didn't mention it in my personal statement, the delicious smell of mesquite-grilled beef and chicken, sometimes wafting down University Drive as far as PV East, also certainly didn't discourage me from returning this year for law school. The Chuckbox has been an affordable, unhealthy indulgence for me for years. It's hard to go wrong with their sandwiches (except maybe with the veggie burger... but I've never tried it), but my favorites are the Guacamole Bacon Burger and the Tijuana Torpedo. In my opinion the fries and onion rings don't quite live up to the glory of the grilled items - I think they buy them frozen - but they're not bad either and I pretty much always order some anyway. Same goes for the fried zucchini: probably frozen, but delicious anyway with a burger.

I find the atmosphere - loud, a little smoky, definitely aptly described as a "shack" - perfectly complementary to the fare, but some might disagree. I've also developed a weird sort of respect for their cash-only policy... this Old-West burger joint doesn't give a damn about catering to the demands of twenty-first-century suburbanites for convenience and they don't have to (well, I guess they do have an ATM in the corner). But I can also see how many would see that as more of an inconvenience than a hip quirk.

If you're in the area, definitely stop by. In an area mostly dominated by chains and cheap, college-town blandness, the Chuckbox is a one-of-a-kind beacon.

Extremely rude people. Wouldn't give them your business. The very large man seems to be super unhappy and unkind to all. No matter how good food is, which its ok, I prefer to be treated kindly. I saw a woman trying to calm her crying baby in the parking lot. She was in a wrong space and he literally told her he didn't care and to move. There are plenty of places around here to go. Why go to a place with a man who stands outside, polices parking, and is grumpy to all?
BEST BURGER around! Also, a fun little joint to sit with some friends and have lunch. Will be back again and again !

This place is an institution... I used to come here back when I was a poor Sun Devil student.

They make the burgers right in front of you on a pulley-system charcoal grill.. and you can notice that in the flavor of the patty.  Plus, they make their patties in varying weight sizes (1/3#, 1/2#, etc) so you can get as much or as little as you want.  The very flattened patty is placed on the grill and I think this is perfect for cooking quickly and safely.. also, moisture is still maintained in the patty since it's not overcooked (what you do when you have thicker patties).

They have pretty typical greasy sides.. fries.. fried zucchini.. onion rings.. it's all good standard grease-stop fare.

I wouldn't at all say this is the cleanest-looking nor the most modern (cash only) or well-maintained burger joint.. but I will say that if you want a no-thrills damn tasty burger, you should give this place a shot.  

I went a couple of nights ago and it sure hasn't changed in the past 7 years... nor has it probably changed in the last 10 years :P  I did, though, really enjoy my 1/3# burger.. cooked to order, simple bun with onions, mayo and ketchup - delish!

Brought a friend from out town here and it was a big hit.!This place has worked for so long because they do burgers and fries the right away...over a charcoal flame right in front of you. When you first walk in you can find the menu is above the grill area, and then you place your order with the person taking orders next to the grill. The menu is short and simple. ..so it shouldn't take long to figure it out.

 I got the standard burger with cheese, and fries. After paying, cash only, you go to the condiment bar and get the toppings you desire.  Rustic atmosphere and TV usually playing some sort of sports game in the corner.  I find the fries (not soggy, just the right amount if crispy)  and burger are  much better here then In and Out.

Incredibly disappointing. This was an ASU staple back in the day but it's gone down hill. It's confusing trying to figure out where the line goes, the wait takes forever and it was very unclean inside. Tasted like typical fast food burgers and gave us all slight indigestion. Cash only. If you want a good burger go to In-n-Out on rural.

Its an ok place to eat.  My daughter loved her food.   I would come here again if I was in the area.  The burgers looked pretty amazing.

 Here's the thing....as we stood in line, they got the two people's order in front of us wrong.  They ended up cooking the burgers for the order for the two people behind me.  So those people ahead of me had to wait for the 6 orders behind me before their burgers were cooked.  Accidents happen but if they rush like this often, that's not a good thing.

Bring your own water.  I don't know if theirs is tap or filtered but if it is filtered, it needs to be changed/maybe have the machine cleaned.

As far as the food goes, this restaurant has one of the best tasting grilled chicken sandwiches! I order the same thing pretty much every time - the regular grilled chicken sandwich with cheddar cheese. Their topping bar is great too so you can help yourself. I typically get lettuce, tomato, onions, & mayonnaise. Their sides are good - my favorite is the onion rings but I've also tried the fries (sometimes a little salty), fried zucchini, & fried mushrooms. This restaurant also has delicious ranch dipping sauce which is one of my favorites for food like this. The line is almost always really long but well worth the wait. It's fun to watch them cook your food in front of you & they serve it cafeteria style. I will say however that a couple of times, when we've ordered our sides, they've gotten a bit cold or have been taken, especially since the wait is a bit longer for chicken to cook than the burgers. The prices are pretty reasonable & it's a great hang out place as well for groups.

I am not a big fan of burgers, but this is always an exception. Each burger is made on the spot which means....you will get a freshly made burger to your desire. I enjoy "the big one" with grilled green chile and pepper jack cheese. Don't forget to get their fried zucchini and their ranch is delicious.
Yo Chuck box... No one likes your shitty burgers. Close down so we can bulldoze your restaurant and make a parking lot for better restaurants like The Original Chop Shop. Thanks.

How much wood could a woodchuck chuck, if a woodchuck could chuck wood?  Sorry.  I went there.  Couldn't resist.  

With that said, that stupid tongue twister is all I could think about inside the Chuck Box.  I certainly wasn't waxing poetic about the food.  I thought the burgers and chicken burgers here were OK, but just average.  The chicken burger with pepper jack was cooked just right, but nothing about it struck me as better than normal.

I've seen other burger joints with condiment bars, and was hoping for something distinctive, but no - just the typical average fixings.  The feel in here is very country or Midwestern with the wooden boxes as stools and burlap sack ceiling.  I dunno.  Can't really place it, but it's very laidback and unassuming here.  I like it, but The Chuck Box felt and tasted just average to me.

Cash only.

Note: do not bring first date here. 

This is a place for a well done burger. Nice people. Convenient location if your on campus. But it is not the prettiest of places.

It's been over a year since I last visited this spot. I used to work a mile away so I would come almost three times a week that I became a regular. Sadly, I switched jobs so I never have the time to drive over to this area. I think after tonight I'm a have to change this habit. 

After eating this burger, I realized why it was one of my favorite burger joints before they started popping all over the valley. It's absolutely terrifying delicious. It's like the best backyard bbq burger! The meat is tender and flavorful! It soaks up the burning wood for that smokey taste. Great seasoning on the burger and that round patch of bacon is awesome. I'm a fan on the way the cheddar combines with the patty on the grill. 

Fries are delicious. Rings are greats. But the burger is what keeps you coming back for me. It's the key to this place. I miss Juan and the older faces because I see a bunch of young cats running the joint. Chuckbox will forever be my go-to spot when I'm being indecisive. I highly recommend this place to everyone. Remember, cash only folks! 

All hail O Great Big One

This is the type of place that exists in practically every college town in the country and hopefully will continue for the foreseeable future. There's nothing fancy about The Chuck Box. They do burgers, chicken sandwich You come in, line up, and get ready to place your order because they don't wait until you're at the counter, instead you get to yell it across the entire restaurant and watch as they don't write anything down, but instead mark the buns with an intricate system of toothpicks, that might be the restaurant version of a semaphore code. Somehow it works though as everyone gets their order and the food is ready (or nearly ready) by the time you get to the front of the line. Also, even though it seems really busy, there's almost a table available once you have your food, although the system can be messed up by people who insist on sitting down while other members of their party get the food.

So next time you're on the ASU campus and you want a genuine college experience, go to The Chuck Box. Oh, and bring cash... they don't take any other form of payment.

The burgers aren't life-changing or super wonderful.  They are yummy and taste very homemade/real.  I did think the workers were very nice considering we aren't the normal clientele (parents and 5 kids including bratty toddler). I think part of their kindness stemmed from not wanting to hold up the line on a Friday night but anything works.  The root beer was so good!!! I don't like onion rings, but my husband is a connoisseur and he didn't like his.

Big burger that you put your own toppings on.  Pretty much have Ketchup, Mustard, Mayo, lettuce, tomato, pickle.  No spread though.

So to make this review quick.

Big burger.  Onion rings and a coke.  12 bucks and change.   You got to be joking right.

Just go to IN-N-OUT and get a Double Double combo and it will be around 7 bucks and taste better.

Chuck Box.  More like Overpriced box.

Our group often pops by The Chuckbox when we are in Arizona for our annual Spring Training trip.  Great burgers, great price!

I hear the complaints about the ambiance, but I come for the burgers, so I don't really care about the decor.

The first time I went to the Chuck Box, I felt like I had De Ja Vu. It seemed like it was exactly like the Original Hamburger Works in Phoenix. Were the same company? I still don't know! Either way, this is a decent place for a quick collegy burger lunch. I enjoy their bbq burgers, the smoky, backyard grill taste, and the cheap prices. However, I don't enjoy the staff and most everything else. Oh, and the clientele can be a little annoying too...as its across the street from ASU. (HAH). I'll give them one thing though-- I do still crave their fried mushrooms from time to time. If you're into this sort of place, I recommend Original Hamburger Works in downtown Phoenix-- less of a hassle, same exact menu, burgers, and condiments bar, but with far less attitude and an old fashioned cowboy bar.
