The place is good. Think of it as going to your neighbor's BBQ. This place isn't gourmet, but who cares. It taste like normal food over the standard commercialized food, which is an awesome change of pace.

The only thing I'd change is the amount of food. I got a Guac cheeseburger and fries and went back for a little one... and STILL was hungry. Ha!

This place is very small and only accepts cash! The burgers are really good! Fries are good too. I had the Tijuana Chile (something Tijuana) burger and it was really good! You get the burger, pick your drink if you want one, pick up your fries if you ordered some, and pay. After you pay you can go put condiments on your burger. It took me off guard that they use paper plates haha. But the burger was so good with oozing melted pepper jack cheese that I didn't care. I'd come here again for sure!

I have to address the "cash only" complaints.  I've worked in the credit card processing industry, and the thing that most consumers don't know, is that when all is said and done, the business (if they're lucky) pays an average of $0.20 cents and 2.5% of the total charge to the credit card industry every time you use your credit card.  That means, that on a $5 burger, it would cost Chuck Box $0.33 cents if you used your card.  That's over 6% of the tab.

Personally, because of the cost of using a credit card to the business, I try to only use a credit card when there's a corporate owner (and believe me, they get much lower processing rates)

Anyways, love the burgers, especially the quac/bacon/cheese burger.  Ok fried 'shrooms, and they have a surprisingly good chili.  I've gone in JUST for the chili and a beer at times

The only real complaint I have about the place is that they open so late on Sundays.  When I lived nearby, there were many a hungover Sunday morning where I knew the only thing that would save my life was some Chuck Box.  Dare to dream that they'd stay open 24/7 . . .

Wow, these are the best burgers and fries I have had in a very long time.  I asked for my burger to be well done, and it was made just right.  You can add all sorts of stuff at the fixings bar - even jalapenos!  I also ordered a delicious pitcher of beer - mmmm - they have several brands on draft.  The onion rings were "just OK".  Try the jalapeno poppers - they are also awesome.  There were four of us and including the beer, the entire meal was less than 30 bucks - you can't beat that!  Service was also outstanding!  CASH ONLY!

While in Tempe ate here twice.  I'm not a huge burger eater but these were awesome.  Loved the size options and then can put your own toppings on.  All cooked right in front of you and to your perfection.  Cash only and very casual atmosphere but we loved that!  Great little place for a burger!

it was ok but  2 burgers a tiny portion of fries and a coke for 14 bucks i coulda went and got sum charcoal and ground beef and made it  at home. next time i want a burger im goingto fat burger. DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE

As long as you are aware going in that this place is a dive, you won't regret having a burger here. We've been coming here for over twenty five years, and they alway serve a consistently good, greasy and delicious burger grilled over an open flame. Just be sure to have cash on hand or be ready to use the nearby ATM as they do not accept credit cards. Good stuff, though, highly recommend!

These people are such jerks. Plus you have to stand in a crowded area waiting for your burger to cook. Can you pay and sit down and wait for your food to be finished?  No... You must stand in a crowd like a fool for your food to be done. I tried to step out of this insanity and just pay... they said no, I had to wait right in front of the grill... "So the video cameras will see me pay". That's their system. What a joke!!! Cancel my order... No thanks. Maybe college kids will put up with communist style service... But no thanks.

The box is THE place to go 4 an excellent, top it yourself (which I like) perfectly cooked burger....I usually have the big one. If you're really hungry go 4 the double. Excellent rings 2. Word of warning though....PAY ATTENTION here folks...NO AC...if you're not a local, this is NOT the place 4 u after May 1st, got it....the rest of us don't wanna hear u crying in July!!!!

Freakin best burgers have ever had. They make everything in front of you, which I absolutely love. Herd about the place from my boyfriend and I am in love! Friendly service, great staff but most importantly great food. Please bring cash before you come here, they do not accept credit or debit card. Kind of noisy but worth it. :-)
I could enjoy a bid bacon cheeseburger every day! Always cooked in front of me, server hot with onion rings. No heat lamps here. Bring cash, no CC accepted.

I had high hopes for this place since the burgers are cooked over a charcoal grill, but unfortunately the taste fell flat, way flat.

The burger had absolutely no flavor - the meat itself was totally bland, the burger was overcooked and there was no charcoal flavor.

The Angus burger at McDonald's has better flavor than this one, and that's pretty bad.
Sorry I accidentally hit takes credit cards, ChuckBox only takes cash. Never fear if you don't have cash, they have an ATM machine in the restaurant.

Felt like memory lane-ing it today, so I headed to Chuck Box. It is as required at ASU as ENG101, so I am an old hand at this, but as a new Yelper, I found myself looking at it with fresh eyes today.

Yeah, you yell your order from the back of a long line. Yeah they clown you if you look confused. Bacon swiss medium. Fries 

"FRIES!" 

Buns are Aunt Hatties, cups are styrofoam, however they go paper on the plates...standard Costco that my mom serves all of our family party meals on.

Meat is great, one of the best burgers in town if only because it is the one of the only left that doesn't resort to frozen patties. Bacon is delightful.

Under 10 for everything including tip. Sat on a wooden box turned sideways. College chic. Okay, college dump, but it is much more wonderful under the haze of a few hundred hungover weekends.

Basically, a very solid independant no frills burger joint, kept thriving by those at ASU, and those like me, who still hold on to that fond charbroiled memory of ASU.

Cash only.

I love me some mesquite grilled burgers. The Chuck Box does it right!  Stopped in tonight as I was really in the mood for a good burger... They absolutely did not disappoint.  Contrary to other reviews, they do have healthy options... Wheat buns. ;-) their fried mushrooms were also very tasty.  Give it a try, you will absolute go back again and again.

Delicious burgers, like the burgers I remember growing up, tasty, juicy and plentiful. I ordered the basic burger with American cheese. The patty was huge and tasty, not dry at all. The buns they use are pretty basic, sesame seed. It did start falling apart towards the end but that may have been because of all the toppings I added. The toppings bar is off to the side so you can add whatever you like and add as little or as much as you like. Their fries, onion rings and fried zucchini were fine, nothing spectacular but weren't bad. CASH ONLY btw!
Good burgers, decent prices the only downside is cash only. I understand there is a fee associated with taking  cards. But it's 2014.

The only bad thing about this place is that they only accept cash. Other than that this place is on my number 1 list for having the best burger I have ever eaten. To describe the burger I had was sooo juicy inside, the outside was chared crispy from the open flame, the bun was air fluffed soft and the cheese was very cheese. I would take a bite I can see the juices from the burger drip. Everytime I think of this place my mouth begins to water :-P

What a great burger, cooked on an open wood fire, with plenty of toppings to go around. Went here on the recommendation of a friend and got the bacon cheese burger with pepper jack. The bacon isn't your usual bacon, something a little closer to canadian bacon. Not crispy but just very thinly cut bacon in a large circle. The fries were really good too and the place has that old wild west outpost feel to it. 

Sadly there's only one drawback to this place: CASH ONLY. I was very sad to see this as I don't carry cash usually. I would have bought much more if I could have used my debit card, and I was really disappointed that i couldn't. This will certainly limit how often I will return.
Favorite spot to grab a burger in the valley! Offering can be complicated so if you didn't go to ASU ask questions. Burners are always exceptional and filling. Give it 11 stars if I could.

One look at this place and you know they are going to serve you up a manly slab of beef!  Great place for burgers, one of my favorites in the phoenix valley.  Its a staple in Tempe, I just hope ASU doesnt tear them down like they do with all the good local places.  Go in and support a great restaurant and get a tasty burger while your at it.  

Condiments bar is a great touch!

Spots okay nothing amazing, always packed inside. Hard to find a seat, only takes cash.. Burgers are nothing crazy.. I've had plenty of better burgers. The selection is nice and free of charge to put anything inside. Place is okay. You can find better in tempe.
Very sad day when the Chuckbox moved from Scottsdale Rd and Shea.  I guess the real-estate was too valuable.  Great prices, now  I have to take a drive BUT well worth it

I have worked a block away from The Chuck Box for the last three years, but I only gave it a shot a couple of months ago, and then I kicked myself for not walking in this place years earlier.  I'm a vegetarian, and this may be the reason I would have never considered going into this place, until I discovered (via Yelp) that they have a veggie burger on their menu.  I order my veggie burger with pepper jack cheese, and two slices of grilled pineapple, and it is delicious.  By the way, hands down, The Chuck Box has the best fries in Tempe.

Now, there are a couple of reasons why I'm giving The Chuck Box four stars instead of five:  1) They only take cash, no cards, and this is a little frustrating in 2009.  There is an ATM in the place, but of course there is a fee for taking cash out, so you can add $2.50 to the cost of your lunch, which can kill the cost-effectiveness of eating at this place.  2) This place can get really busy and the ordering system is abrasive, i.e. the cook yelling at people to take their order.  Now, some people probably love this system, because it creates a unique atmosphere, but I just find it kind of nerve-racking.

A side note for vegetarians: If you have a problem with your food being cooked on grill that has had meat products cooked on it, where your veggie burger is in close proximity to meat on the grill, you will probably have a problem eating here.

A great new fun memory. 5 stars for the entire experience and service. The burger was great and reminded me of a backyard BBQ. 

Good times. Thanks

Great Burgers and it's next to ASU in Tempe. This place is always a fun and a tasty treat. The outside is an old rusty brown building that reminds me of a hippie shack out in the woods. The smell of mesquite smoke and burgers hit you as you get out of your car. The inside is also very hip with a simple old timey feeling such as thick wooden crates for seats, barrels for trash cans and amusing tidbits hanging on the walls.

Easy menu to pick from with several burger or chicken options as well as sides. You can choose from Little to Big to Great BIG as far as sizes of burgers. I always get the Great BIG one which is a 1/2 pound of juicy CHUCK with the cheese of my choice and some green chilies. They cook it right before your eyes while standing in line. I also enjoy the onion rings which are beer battled and really big and tasty. The condiment bar is very large with plenty of room to stock up on all the things you would want at a family picnic and then some. Nice.

Parking is tricky being next to the campus. Bring change for the meter if you cannot get in their private lot. Also get there as early as possible to avoid the long line of HUNGRY people. CASH ONLY. Enjoy!

Perfect timing as we rolled into this joint just before a massive crowd built up behind us about 8pm on a Saturday night. Our two burgers were the only ones on the grill for a good five minutes before an avalanche of chicken and beef entered the foray. I ordered my 1/3 pounder from Juan well done and it was fresh beef and seasoned with salt/pepper it seemed. Good sesame buns and a solid order of onion rings (its from a bag, but a gourmet bag at least). Condiment bar was well stocked and it was  a great burger with a unique ordering experience and atmosphere. Unless your at Behihana, you never get to interact with the cook, so now if he didn't make it well done. I can give up it right back, but it was. so no problem. Probably the best in the $6 burger category.

This place has amazing food. Don't be fooled by the way it looks!!
It is not very customer service orientated but the food makes up for it. Trust me
Amazing burger spot. Juan (who's worked there for 30+ years) really has the science of a perfectly grilled burger figured out. With that and competitive prices you can't go wrong.

I am always in search of a good burger...while my search will always continue this place will go in my top 5! We must have gotten there just at the right time because there wasn't much of a line. I did however see the "cash only" sign right away which might be annoying to some. This is my kinda place though-a hole in the wall with delicious simple food! I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and I loooove how they made the circular bacon to fill the whole burger! I can see how the condiment station might be a turnoff for some but considering I like my burger pretty plain it didn't really bother me. We rode the light rail so we didn't have issues with parking but I can see how the parking might be problematic around lunch time. I dig the tree stumps as chairs but that's just me. We got 2 burgers/fries and 2 drinks for 20 bucks and it was worth every penny. Every few months I think about becoming a vegetarian, it's places like this that make me realize what a ludicrous idea that would be!

So, I finally got to try the Chuck Box. I took the advice of other reviewers and stayed away from The Little One and got The Big One and was very happy with it. First of all, BRING CASH - no cards accepted. There was a small setback while we were waiting for the food to be cooked, however the staff handled it very well and quickly picked up the slack. My boyfriend got the Tijuana Torpedo with green chilies on top. It was great. So were the onion rings, perfectly cooked! Wash it all down with a lemonade = VERY REFRESHING! I can't wait to go back. With all of those toppings, I'm sure even the garden burger would be delicious! (Not that I don't like garden burgers; I do! I just didn't think it would be the best representation of the Chuck Box.)
It's been a while since I've been here and it's been too long.  Burgers are outstanding!  This a quintessential college joint, a true gem in Tempe.

I really liked The Chuck Box. It was recommended to us by a friend. It's not a fancy place by any stretch but the wood-fired burgers are great. They do not wait on you. You go through line after you order and pick up your order as it is made. I will go there again the next time we are in Tempe.

No frills and chill burger joint. Cheap too! Their fried zucchini and fried mushroom sides were interesting.

I got the barbecue chicken sandwich, which takes longer to cook. Boyfriend got the big burger. They have a toppings bar, so that was cool!

Parking lot is tight and the line can get long during dinnertime. Also, it's cash only, but there's an ATM inside.

I thought it was cool they have wine on tap!

It's cheap enough that I would come back if I wanted a burger better than McDonald's but didn't want to cook it myself.

They grill the burgers with coal. Hank Hill would be mad!

this wood shack has been in tempe for as long as i can remember and i've probably been.. two times, maybe three?
for as much as everyone swears by these burgers, i thought they were just ok. it's served and order counter style, so it's very casual -and very busy at lunch time during the week.
nothing in particular to complain about, just didn't wow me.

Nothing great about this burger. The grill is most impressive. After that it just ok. Part of it may be expectations. I had high expectations because it reminded me of a grill place in Albuquerque. I can't decide if that is it, or I just didn't like the burger. Green Chile was like lettuce, iceberg lettuce. The onions that I piled on, were also flavorless. However, I did think they had the smoothest, great tasting root beer! Wow. Now that is special. I wish it was sugar free so I could drink more of it, but no. I just had a few sips from Brad's glass. It is dark inside, which I liked. The decor is simple and ingenious. Very comfortable seating. Had to try it, but probably won't be back.

One of the best local burger joints around.

Its a unique experience. A definite must for ASU students and visitors. This place is part of history. The burgers are fairly priced and taste delicious. The environment is unlike any other burger chain.

Quick service. Great burgers. Cash only though.

Have you ever had a feeling that you feel that you ate too much but you still feel good and not heavy? It's that kind of place. It tells you for the quality of food. I used to think rehab burger is the best joint in Phoenix..but then yesterday I went to Chuck box. Simple and cheap menu but it the meat is fresh and light. They cook it right infront of you and you can see the sizzle. It's a perfect place to go for a burger. Cash only so be prepared. I believe it's the best burger in the valley. One of the best I have ever had. Awesome!!!!!!

Best burger in Phoenix. (Disclaimer: I've only lived here for a year, but that being said, thus far, best burger I've found around these parts) 
PS get the onion rings!!!

This is where you go for an AMAZING burger. The food quality is just unbelievable! First time here I really wanted jalapeo poppers but the order was too big considering i ordered fries and a burger and onion rings already all of which were superb!  As if that wasn't good enough one of the guys brought me a small order with 3 jalapeo poppers and they we're so delicious! It has a nice little kick back feel to the place. I will definitely be  back, the prices are so reasonable and the food has such a great taste and quality to it. If you like good food and great prices definitely come here! Literally best burgers in town! Lenny's ain't got nothing on them! I would literally give this place 10 stars if I could.

Upon entering the chuck burger, I was welcomed with a yelling "WHOS NEXT" and an annoyed request for my order.  Although they have guacamole, the chefs are too lazy to slice avocado for more health conscious customers.  The bacon guacamole burger was a 7/10, pretty good! The fries weren't bad, but the tap water leaves an unpleasant metallic aftertaste.  Although the food is good, I would not come again.

This place is the real article. The meat is cooked right in front of you and it's all custom. The fixings bar rocks. Everything is really fresh and delicious and the ambience is what you expect for this type of food.

Everyone talked about this place and how great the burgers were. I have to disagree... I didn't like that there were not a lot of bun options or even topping options. To me, it was just a plain burger I could have made at home and paid less. In and out serves better burgers.

The best burger I've ever had.  I feel like almost everyone in Tempe knows this already but I was reviewing another lesser than burger place and all I could think about was why didn't I just go to chuck box? Get the big one with bacon and maybe try the grilled green chilli pepper on top!

06/29/2018. Great place if your craving a nice grilled burger or chicken. The menu is pretty simple and your able to add your own unlimited toppings. I love the bacon its comes in round shape perfect for your burger. Onion rings were perfectly cooked.

One of the best burger joint there is in AZ. Fresh grilled burgers on an open flame grill they use wood/logs and not charcoal. Cooks it right front of you and you wait for your burger to be finished cooking before you pay. 

I first found this place when I was going to ASU, some classmates and I were wanting to go somewhere to study for our final exam and we were all hungry. One classmate referred this place. So we ended up here and I loved it.

I havent been here for years after, until one day my BF was craving for a burger and he wanted a real burger. Not no Mcdonalds or Burger King burgers. So I told him there was this burger joint that I once went to when going to school. I took him over here. He ordered a one patty burger and I had the chicken sandwich and he was in Love. He never knew about this place and always wanted find a place that makes a real burger. Now hes all about Chuck Box. The second time I brought him here he ordered the double patty. It was quite big and fulfilling for him. We usually order a side of fries and sometimes the onion rings as well.

Theres a condiment station when in the middle of the shop where you can add whatever you want on your burger which is pretty cool because its to your liking and you can put whatever on it. 

One side note: they ONLY accept cash. So make sure you have cash before you come here. However they do have a atm machine, but to avoid getting charge a fee I suggest you come with cash in hand ready.

This immediately became my "i need to eat here every time I'm in Phoenix spot." I don't even care that it's not cooked to my preferred medium-rare. It's that good. Cool spot. Love watching them cook it right in front of you. Great that you get to put whatever ratio and amount of toppings on yourself. Instant favorite.
Flying solo.  It's a burger joint.  Plain and simple.  Small menu with the basics.  But the basics are so good.   Great burger.  Juicy.  Cooked just right.  Would love to come back.

My boyfriend and I LOVE this place! The burgers are cooked right there in front of you so they are really fresh and hot! No worries about what you want on it except cheese. There is a condiment bar so make it your way! There fries were pretty good. And the burger maker guy was cool! The cash guy lacked personality but maybe he was having a off day!
The only draw back is the cash only part...But 3 of us ate for 25 bucks!!

Even after all these years, the Chuck Box is still cranking out the beat burgers.  They have been doing burger the right way since my first visit in 1979.  They still only accept cash, they do have an ATM if you forget.  Great selection of toppings including jalapeos. Only item missing was Thousand Island.  Even without it the burgers were great.  We were not even the oldest either.  We can't wait to go back.  Small is perfect for most appetites but they have bigger sizes for larger appetites.
A very good charbroiled burger. Lots of topping choices. Onion rings were awesome and most importantly,  they are effecient.

We heard about this place constantly for a year when we moved here, so we had to give it a shot. I would go back for the atmosphere.  The food and price was alright, considering the atmosphere.  I really like the way they decorate the place, and the fact their toppings you can throw on yourself were fresh every time we showed up.

This place is the real deal if you want some awesome burgers near ASU. Chuck Box has been around for decades and I just had to see what the burgers were all about. I decided to try their small cheeseburger and fries. You can tell that them putting the patties on the charcoal grill makes a huge difference as far as taste, and it was very good. Their fries too are some of the better ones that I've had as well.

While the food was certainly very good and I would come back here again, there are some gripes that I have with this place. Parking around here can be difficult which could potentially deter me from coming here more often. Also, the ordering assembly line style can be awkward somewhat at times but it's not a big deal to me. As long as the food is good I don't really care about those things but I just wanted to make others aware of them.

I do anticipate coming back here again as the food was excellent.

Omg I couldn't love this place any more than I do. They will always be a great place to get a burger your way! I love the sitting area, its old school fabulous and doesn't change. Change isn't always better. They cook the burger to your liking, you add what you want on it. It goes fast so don't be discouraged when you see the line. Its so cool to watch the guy cooking. You will love it and your burger too!

I've been driving past The Chuck Box for years, but never stopped and ate until yesterday! Brian and I were in the mood for a nice juicy burger after church and just happened to drive by and decided to pull in. Thank God we did! OMG... this rustic looking burger joint in the heart of Tempe has the best fricken burger in town! Grilled right over a fire, this chef is Amazing; we enjoyed just watching him cook the burgers - a treat in itself! We were impressed how fast the service is how the burgers are cooked JUST PERFECT.  The 'fix'n' bar is cold and fresh - the tomatoes were my favorite! Mmmm... I could go on and on... I'm getting hungry again just thinking about it. I had the great big one and Brian had a double great big one. We also got fries, onion rings, and two beers. Everything was GREAT = we'll be back!
Nice smoked burgers cooked on a real charcoal grill in a quaint little southwest style cabin. I like the "great big one" with green chillies (aka: tijuana torpedo).

I came here on a Monday night around 9PM.  There were a few small groups in the restaurant, if you want to call it that.  Their burger is similar to a BBQ burger.  Nothing too unique about the taste.  Fries though were crispy and fried well.  The condiment bar was well kept and fresh.  The ambiance was pretty depressing.  I felt like I was in a tavern established along an interstate.  I needed to get in, get out with something in my stomach that would get me by.  Job accomplished.

The best way I would sum up ChuckBox is that it is a really really good backyard burger. It's very juicy and delicious. The burgers are simple, and that's how I like.

Notes: Cash only, ATM inside

Pretty much the best burger I've had in about 8 years... been there a few times now, and they are consistently good.  As others have mentioned, cash only... Also not cheap.. but simple and really good for what it is.  I suggest going later in the afternoon, or get there around 11 or slightly earlier, they are packed during lunch/dinner, but 3:30 if you do a late lunch or early dinner is pretty mellow.

Onion rings are great, as is the fried zucchini and the fries are decent too.

The bad reviews really bug me. If you don't like the burgers it's your own fault because literally everything on it is because of you! It is the most authentic backyard barbecue/ campfire burger you can get. It's served on paper plates just like a campsite or a backyard barbecue. Are we too classy for paper plates? The burger has charred edges and makes it authentic and amazing. And the cost?? You can't. Can't. CANT! Beat that cost. You are doing yourself a disservice by not coming here. Only downside is cash only. NOTHING food related. I will be back. OFTEN.

Man, I usually have my spots but after word of mouth from a friend, and seeing the reviews I HAD to  come check this place out!! This place throws down on some burgers!!

I got the Tijuana Torpedo, wifee got the cheeseburger. We got the drinks and fries, but saw they had beer battered onion rings. I'm a sucker for them, so you already know !

The food was amazing! Sounds like a lot of hype but very very good and reasonably priced. The grill chef cooked the burgers perfect! Tipped him just for that fact! 
Very appreciative he prepared my meal. Did I mention they cool on a charcoal grill!!

You can tell the fryer oil was fresh too. My fries were golden colored, and not tinted like fries cooked in old oil usually look. Onion rings golden brown....SO GOOD!

The condiment bar was all fresh, and the crate style seating is awesome!!

Note: 
Make sure to bring cash. If you don't have any no worries, they have an atm inside.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

Great burger joint that's reasonably priced (for a large grilled burger)  It's a little pricier than fast food, but it's much more than any fast food burger. They work pretty fast to get the line through and get the orders done. It can be a bit of a cattle chute - but that tends to be part of the atmosphere. They have a large, if pretty standard condiment bar - ketchup, mustard, lettuce, pickles. If you want something beyond that, this is not the place - unless you bring it along.

First of all, the ordering process is hassling at best. You have to wait in line with tons of rowdy, ugly college students/grumpy elderly folk for your order. They need to have a better format for that because the lines are constantly crowded with people jostling each other.

Second, my dad makes better burgers. And his are only moderately satisfying. There was nothing special about these burgers, and don't get me started on the substandard wings. I feel like I insulted myself and my taste buds just by letting myself go to this place. You can find better, cheaper burgers at In-n-out.

:)

First things first, this is the best burger in Tempe.  Juicy, flavorful, and just the right size (if you get the great big one).  Good selection of condiments, too.

The onion rings and mushrooms are good, too (although it's hard to finish the mushrooms).  Nothing like a pile of grease to get your heart a workout.

The fries are nothing special.  They taste like your standard notch-above-BK fries... Not crap, but won't have you coming back like Five Guys fries.

I went to ASU for 4 years and only visited ChuckBox once due to my roommate dragging me along.  I remember it being packed and we ended up having to sit outside in the heat so my experience at that time wasn't the best and I never went back.
However the other day I was craving a burger and decided to give it another try.  Man, I don't know what I was thinking the first time around.  The burgers are amazing!  I love the charbroiled taste! 
It does take a while to get your foot because it is cooked as needed right in front of you, so the line can grow to be fairly long while people stand there and wait for their order.  They have a bar in the middle of the restaurant that has all the fixins for you to add to your burger (ketchup, mayo, lettuce, tomatoes, etc.)
Some of the downsides that made me give them 4 stars instead of 5 is that there are no refills on drinks, it's cash only, and there aren't any covers for the small fixin bar (there where a couple of flies hovering around the lettuce and pickles that grossed me out).
But in terms of their burgers, they are delicious!

So...
I stopped in around mid afternoon for a couple of cheeseburgers with mom and I gotta say it's been awhile since I've been able to get in due to heavy foot traffic for this establishment. I ordered and sat with our food and it was very dry and not even juicy like it was the last few times. I seen him cook burgers before but... he had a large takeout order after ours and I guess he forgot how to cook.
So disappointed with this place.
Love the hamburgers and that they have A1 steak sauce. Onion rings are good also. They only take cash though.

Friends and I  were near Tempe and it's spring break so we might actually get in without much of a line.  Crowded but not overly so, recognized a staff member of two that were still there from my ASU days.  Brings back good memories and a few foggy ones, burgers are still nice and fresh but thin and spread out instead of thick which is fine, if you want a medium you might order a medium rare and adjust the other options as needed.  Great to get back to an old time favorite.

The positive is that the ingredients are fresh and you are able to moderate what's on your burger. Ummmm..still thinking....yeah that was the positive. The burgers are okay nothing to come
Running back to. The place has an original appeal but always seems unclean.  I've had better I've had worse. If you want a burger and are in the area this will do.

Mmmm... Chuck Box... Droooool...

So this place looks kind of run down, some of the staff looks a little scary, and there's literally a 1" thick layer of grime on the brick next to the grill that's probably taken 40 years to build up, but damn is it a good burger. This is one of those places where they go out of their way to disgust you and you still come back because the food is so good.

This place is awesome! My girlfriend doesn't like burgers but if its Chuck box, she craves it!!!

The burgers and fries are good, but a MUST try are the jalapeo poppers!! These things are freaking delish to the point I have to get one for me and one for the girlfriend. 

When we go to AZ this is 1 of 3 spots we must make time to eat at!

Average burger joint, I like the idea of making your own burger but there's nothing really unique about the taste. Burger was average tasting, the bun was sesame seed average, and the toppings were average as well. I'd go here again if it was my only choice at the time.

One of the best if not the best burger in AZ. 

Very simple, great ingredients and the best tasting grilled meat.  

You place your order and then watch it being cooked, then head over to the condiments bar which is always fresh and filled with great ingredients.  The place has a nice old western vibe and the focus on the food which is all you want when you go to grub.

Wow. This is everything a no-frills burger place should be. The burgers are cooked on the open charcoal grill right in front of you as you wait. They have a perfect list of toppings for your burger without it being overwhelming. We went around noon on a Tuesday while school was not in session. No wait and just enough room for me and my 5 coworkers. I can imagine it's probably busier during the school year. 

I got the The Big One with cheese, bacon and green chile and a side of fries. It was the perfect size for me for lunch. I couldn't get over how amazing the flavor was on the burger. I'm still thinking about it three days later. The fries were good but nowhere near the star. I would've been fine without them. But that burger. Mmmmm. I can't wait to go back!!

PS - It's cash only but they do have an ATM on-site. Also, it's very affordable!

So Michael and I drove all the way here on Sunday because he was craving a hamburger (again)... of course there are quite a few places in central phoenix that have good burgers but I guess we were feeling adventurous and decided to travel to downtown Tempe to the Chuck Box.   I have memories of the Chuck Box from when I was a little kid and used to go to work with my dad during the summer... he worked at the ASU Student Book Center on College Ave and we would come here often for lunch.  Back then everything seemed much bigger from the size of the place to the size of the burgers.   While Michael and I were perusing the menu we noticed (out loud) that the menu and the condiment bar were almost exactly the same as Hamburger Works in Phoenix.  The guy behind the counter mentioned that the manager of the Chuck Box was part owner of Hamburger Works... it all makes sense now:)... and i guess we didn't have to drive that far after all.   The burgers were tasty and so were the fries... it really hit the spot!

Best Burger in Tempe.
Guys are great and the atmosphere is refreshing no chain burger joint a real treat !!!

What you get: Burgers grilled over mesquite while you sweat in front of the fire, a table of fix in's to complete your masterpiece, and ice cold beer in a mason jar.  Oooooh, baby..

The Chuckbox is a worthy Tempe institution.  It looks like it was built by the first settlers, and they did a damn fine job.  At lunch time there's usually a line, so it can be harder to gain admission here than at ASU.  But it's worth he wait (and it won't take 4 years to get out).

The big one (with cheese) is terrific, and so delicious even beer like Michelob tastes good.  Or get an incredibly delicious Great Big One, or fries or rings or shrooms.  On a nice day, the porch is great for watching the world  go by while getting mustard on your shirt.  You just can't go wrong here.

If you're not alone, the pitcher is a better deal.  Dont worry, if you look thirsty, they'll remind you.

This place is a total hole in the wall you walk in and it seems like your in the middle of Juarez. the roof is covered in bean sacks, tables are made of crates, the place doesn't take credit cards cash only but the food makes up for it! Awesome fresh burgers cooked in front of you also a good local beer selection which is served to you in a mason jar. Gotta love it.

This is great spot to get a flame broiler burger and your own fixings.  The prices are great.  Come if you're craving a burger and you're in the area.  Def not necessary to make a trek over.  Parking is sparse and the place will likely be packed with college students.

Best place to get a burger in Tempe! The burgers have that off the bbq grill taste which is the best. Been here twice and i was not disappointed at all.The condiment bar is cool too. I like how it's decorated in the inside. It has a cow boy theme to it which alot of people hate for some reason. It's cash only but going there when you only have cash makes it a special treat.

The Chuck Box has fresh and delicious burgers and chicken sandwiches.  They grill  your food right in front of you and they have a great condiment bar so you can get just the right amount of toppings.

On our first trip I ordered a chili cheese burger. The burgers were huge and the chili kept sliding off. It was so messy I couldn't enjoy it. The place was packed, the line was long and my overall feeling was "meh". I didn't plan to return. 

Recently I went back with my brother when there was a small, reasonable line (and he wanted a burger). This time I went with a basic cheeseburger. My brother had a bacon cheeseburger with fries. We both enjoyed the fresh meat and toppings. They also had a fruity  iced tea which not only tasted great but was very fresh. It's now back "on the list" of burger spots!

I'd heard of this place but had never been there until the other day when I was in the area and we decided to stop for lunch. It was ok, dumpy and hot inside, restrooms are located out back. I get that this is probably one of those places people are nostalgic about more than a place they visit for the food itself.  Our chargrilled burgers were ok, I guess for the money I'd prefer to go somewhere a little nicer and more comfortable than sitting on a wooden crate. The onion rings were probably the best part.

Large burgers that will be sure to stuff you! The outside and inside may appear a little dingy but don't let that steer you away. It wasn't the best burger I've ever had but it certainly was worth every penny I paid.
Good atmosphere and great burgers! Loved the fries and their ranch! Definitely need to check it out

I realized today I haven't reviewed my favorite burger joint in the valley. The Chuckbox is truly the best burger place in town. I am careful with the types of oils I put in my body. I don't have any really weird requirements I just prefer to eat things that are natural, not chemically altered mutations. That being said Chuckbox uses healthy oils (still fattening but not mutated) for their French fries and it is fabulous to indulge in that sinful pleasure. Their burgers are made of the highest quality meat and cooked to order (yes even rare) on a huge wood burning grill. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. If you are a true foodie I know you have already discovered this Tempe gem but if you haven't get in your car and head there ASAP. You will thank me profusely for this review. I would give them 10 stars if I could. One thing before you go, bring cash, they do not take credit cards. Enjoy!!!!!

Went to Chuckbox with a group of friends. First of all, I don't think it was stated enough it's closer to a fast food place than restaurant. It's a similar setup to Ted's Hot Dogs except it's pretty dark in there and when we went there were only 2 people working there. 1 guy on grill, 1 at register and doing everything else while he was at it. Which meant he wasn't always at the register. The burgers were good, not great and I'm not sure I agree with most of the hype. Great place if I lived near ASU to walk and grab a quick burger but overall it was pretty average.
Not so good sorry. Dirty, and just not good. Will not go back  the service was awful, the condiments were old and crusty! There was no A/C, the tables were dirty. Didn't want to eat my food there!

So I came to the chuck box off of a recommendation from a friend.  He stated that it was the best burger he's ever had and even was wanting to throw down a 20 dollar bet on this burger he was so confident.   Well after my first visit here I think he owes me 20 bucks. 

First I want to say that I've had a lot of burgers in my day.  Some really good and some really bad.  One of the first signs to me of a burger that won't break my top 3 list is when I can't order it medium rare.  

We got to the chuck box around noon and the place was packed to the gills.  We waited in line and I ordered the big one with cheddar on a white bun.  The burger looked decent off the grill but the bun was something I could buy at Costco (another sign of a top 3 ranking burger is a good home made bun)

I didn't have an issue with the lack of options at the condiment bar other than how the onions were diced to put on a burger made for an awkward experience. 

First bite was decent enough and all the onions then fell off the burger due to how they were diced.  About half way through the burger, my bun was completely falling apart.  The onion rings were decent but yet again I've had better.  

All in all it wasn't a bad burger but it wasn't at all the best I've had.   I'm pretty sure this place stays in business because it's on a college campus, it's cheap, and what college kid doesn't love a good cheap burger.  Since I have no college memories of this place to make it seem better than it really is I am impartial and can just rate the food.  All in all a decent experience but doubtful I will make the drive again for lunch.

This was by far the best meal I had all week.  

CONS:
*cash only - I HATE that.  Very inconvenient.  I never have cash.
*the process of standing in line, yelling your order over and then waiting for your food to be cooked while still standing in line.

PROS:
*$20 for 2 big burgers, fries and a pitcher of beer!!!
*The most delicious Tijuana Torpedo burger ever
*yummy fries
*ice cold, frosted beer glasses

I can't wait to go back.  The topping bar did nothing for me but the chili and cheese on my burgers were plenty for taste and moisture.

I have driven by this place so many times and always wanted to stop in.  We decided to take the light rail this weekend and check it out.  Delicious burgers and fries in a rustic, fun setting.  Love that you can top your own burger too.  Make sure to bring enough cash or your card to withdrawal money...no credit cards accepted here.  Friendly staff too!

Love this place....they do burgers right! Great service too....the guys are real down to earth and customer focused....the
Menu is relatively small.....but there's no reason to eat a burger anywhere else inTempe.....

Excellent yummy deliciousness and all of the above!
I'm visiting from Cali,SD & driving around Ariz. Lookin for a Spot to eat, I stumble into this littl corner of Real Charbroil heaven! Food is so dam good and customer service is off the grill!  "the grill master-Juan is #1"!
On my way back to Cali, I grabbed a box to go. 
I soooo recommend this spot. Mmmmm good

Been to this place since I was a kid and still have the best burgers around.  They do everything charcoal grill which taste so good.  Only burger joint I know that serve beer on tap.  Cash only place.  They do not accept credit card since they have to keep the price down.
Chuckbox before an ASU football game.  Great tradition and great burgers.  The Tijuana Torpedo is my favorite.  Good tasting onion rings as well.

I was told that the Chuckbox would have the best burger I EVER had, ever.  
I was not lied to.
The 1/2 pound burger I had was fantastic.  I also had onion rings and and an ice cold beer to wash it all down.
Their menu is not extensive, but it did not need to be.  They do one thing, and they ARE the best.  
Well, at least the best I've ever had yet.
If you can recommend a better burger: please let me know.

I really don't get what all the fuss is about. There was really nothing special, nothing even average about the place. The burger had no flavor to it - just tasted like ordinary ground beef with seasoned salt. The fries weren't all that great, and the bun was nondescript. There was a ton of bacon, which may sound like a good thing, but several layers of thin bacon will never beat a single layer of good quality thick-cut bacon.

It really isn't the friendliest place around - the guy taking orders wasn't really rude, but didn't seem to go out of his way to be friendly.

But it did get very busy a little after I got there, so obviously a lot of people disagree with me. But I don't think I'll be back.

I sometimes forget how great a burger is served here. Flam cooked to order with your choice cheese, Chile or sauce. Great for everyone with choices of chicken, beef and veggie burgers. Toppings are added on at your choice from a toppings bar located inside the "box."

This place is the BOMB!!! Bring your outside voice when you order here cause you may find yourself at the back of the line and being asked what you want. The burgers are cooked on an open flame right in front of you and are full of flavor. I can make one of these at home but when eating out this is the place to go. Get a Great Big One!

If you don't have a grill in your own backyard and are looking for a classic American 4th of July BBQ in the park kind of burger, The Chuckbox is the place for you. We finally visited this place after hearing about it from even before coming to Arizona. It is a bit of a legendary location in the local community.

The atmosphere reminded me of a loud, crowded cafeteria, which is not my style for dining in. I found the ordering process to be unpleasant. You basically stand in a huge line and wait for the burgers to be cooked, which does take a few minutes. Meanwhile, the line interweaves with people who are placing orders, so everyone is in everyone's way. Then, once you receive your food, you wait another 5 or so minutes for someone to come to the register and cash you out. Ironically, while you wait with your ever-cooling food at the register, you are faced with a sign that explains how they only accept cash because it keeps the line moving fast...

The burger itself was pretty good, but nothing unique or special. As I mentioned, it really makes you think of that classic American grilled burger. One thing that I liked was the condiments bar, which allows everyone to add their own extras to their plain burger. In particular, I noticed that the tomatoes, pickles, and jalapeos were all extremely fresh. It's hard to get a decent tomato at a Subway or a even a 20-star fancy restaurant, so I commend this place for serving such fresh toppings. In addition, I took a bite of a very tasty not-so-all-American garden burger, which tells me some of the non-traditional burgers may be worth trying.

Went here when I was visiting Tempe! Decent place with the grill out by the counters. I got a chicken burger which was good but not too great! Also got the fried mushrooms which could have been seasoned better.  

Also, they are CASH ONLY so remember to swing by the ATM.

I usually try to make it here a couple of times a month but in all seriousness I could eat here every day and never get tired of the place. Best to get there before 11:00 just to find a place to park. Nothing beats a great cheese burger and a cold draft beer.

Been here once in 2010 but it was great.  It's a throwback to the 80s, no credit cards accepted, cash only.  Not sure how much business they lose doing this but it's a local eatery, it's that place you only know about if you live here.  Burgers were delish, freshly cooked, great flavor.  If you're after great tasting meat, and you're not vegetarian, come here.

Chuck Box = best fast food burger in the Phoenix area.  Not to mention, they're fries are awesome.  Their fried zucchini is to die for.  Yes, you might clog an artery eating here, but it's a burger joint.  I'd much rather gain a couple of pounds here than at McDonald's or its counterparts.
Great burgers!  Their grilled chicken sandwich with green chilies is pretty incredible too.  Thank you, Chuck Box Team for always making our visit delicious & memorable.

I fly to Arizona just have a burger at the Chuckbox...ok just kidding.
I travel to PHX fairly often and one night I was jonesing for a burger. I called up Fatburger and they were closed at 8PM. OK seriously, who closes a burger joint in a college town at 8PM? That's just pure insanity but I digress. So there was no burger to be had and I had to has a cheeseburger NOW! By a stroke of luck someone mentioned the chuck wagon and I wondered how bad could it be? I trekked through ASU and then I reached meat heaven. It wasn't the Chuck Wagon, it was the Chuck Box. I ordered my cheeseburger and fries. Just picture that scene in When Harry Met Sally. It was so good I needed a cigarette when I was done.

I've been back a few times and the last time I tried the Chili. It was a generous serving, very tasty and most importantly it didn't give me the farts.

Best Burger in the valley! Even the Garden Burger is Amazing! The condiments are always fresh especially the tomato's.  Reasonably price, just be aware this is a cash only business! Parking can be a pain some times but that's any where on or around campus! The employees are very straight forward, If you're cool with them they will be cool with you! Be ready to order, they'll ask you what you want while your standing in line. I recommend adding green chilly to any of the burgers! Don't forget to order fries, they are not included..


The Chuck Box Is Number Juan!!

The chuck box was good. The setting was pretty cool when walking in and the service was great. The food was good and had taste. You can put whatever you want on your burger as they have a salad bar for your amenities.

I came and had lunch and it was your standard fair. Another time I was a paying customer and needed to run to a separate business and they actually had a bouncer make me move my car despite having utilized their business. That ticked me off.  No question about how much time i might need (20 minutes) just to blow off. So i get they need their parking, but during summer and with a good 7 or 8 other empty spots cut ppl slack. Consequently I am never going there and I am going to ly think bad of you. Btw, it's hot in your shack, your decor sucks and the seats uncomfortable and the condiments bar looks like it came out of my 5th grade cafeteria memories.

pros:
- probably the best burger i've ever had
- unique toppings
- wood charcoal grill
- fast service
- friendly owner

cons:
- cash only
- cold customer service

burgers alone, the chuck box takes the cake. they've perfected wood-fired grilling and manage to cook the meat to the right amount of juicy every time. they have ortega chilis that are to die for, bacon circles, pineapple, and anything else you could want on a burger. their chicken sandwiches are good, especially with teriyaki, but don't compare to their burgers.

by and large, though a couple staff members are amiable and talkative (especially the owner), the customer service is unfriendly, and even borders on rude. the restaurant exudes a pretty palpable sense of toxic masculinity, amplified by the western glorification theme, and this mentality seems to be adopted by some staff members. in terms of your experience here, this becomes relevant in the differences in respect they show toward men and women; my mom is never treated the same as my dad. an unfortunate and completely avoidable situation, but one that seems only to be perpetuated by their new hires. 

one last note: they only take cash, but have an ATM inside. would strongly recommend for a quick bite while in the ASU area.

One of the best classic burgers you can get. Gourmet burgers are amazing, but most of the time I just want something a little more simple, and this place does that the best. The staff is friendly and I love watching them make the burgers right in front of you. Insanely reasonable price too.

This is our favorite burger place.  We don't live close, but are willing to make the drive at least a couple times a month for this place. Our kids love it and have even requested it as their birthday dinner. I always get the Big One with cheddar.  The jalapeno poppers and fried zucchini are a must have.  The condiment bar has everything you need and has great ranch for dipping.  The cost is fair, for 2 people burgers and drinks with poppers and zucchini to share will run you about $21 dollars.  They only take cash so make sure you're prepared or you'll have to use the ATM inside which charges a fee.

The place looks very dirty and run down and you have to sit on crates.  The employees aren't the friendliest and the cashier/fry guy in the do-rag is scary (think Soup Nazi for you Seinfeld fans) so you better make sure you order correctly and quickly including which type of bun, stand in the correct spot while waiting for your food (basically right in front of the soda machine), move when you're supposed to (as soon as they call out your burger), have your cash ready and don't talk to him (unless you're going to talk about Star Trek).  

If you want clean and friendly don't come here, but if you're looking for the best burger around make sure to give it a try. The place can get pretty busy especially during the school year, so if you don't want to stand in a very large line try to get there for a late lunch or early dinner.

First off, this place has a great name. One of the most famous burger places in the Valley, and definitely the most famous in Tempe. The building itself is pretty iconic. It's an all wood shack that you'd swear should be next to a swamp somewhere in Louisiana. Inside, you're immediately smacked in the face with a smokey aroma as they use a wood-fired broiler to give the burgers a mesquite flavor. It's set up cafeteria-style and kind of feels like you're expected to know how to order as it's all customizable with a  selection of toppings, cheeses, and bun types. For the veggies and sauces, there's a self-serve salad bar style set up for further customization.

The Burger - 7.5 (out of 10)
The marquee aspect of this burger is definitely the wood-flame broil as so few places cook their burgers that way. It's not the most practical cooking method and makes for a really smokey environment. Is the Burger Guy convinced this is a better burger cooking method than a well seasoned griddle? Nah. But it does give the burger a distinct flavor. The flame broil gives it a nice char that you can't get with a griddle. I got The Big One, a 1/3 pounder that I added American cheese and bacon too. My burger was juicy, cooked perfectly, and had a really nice flavor. What I wasn't impressed with was, well, everything else. The bun was a very pedestrian sesame seed job. The bacon, likewise, nothing to write home about. The veggies were basic but even the iceberg lettuce was looking pretty pitiful. And my biggest gripe: Because of the broiler, they can't grill onions! And you all know how The Burger Guy feels about grilled onions. A burger just isn't complete without them. Lastly, I don't think I like building my own burgers. I always screw up the ratios! Overall, a pretty delicious meat patty that's dragged down by the other components of the burger.

Note: Score is for the burger only. Other factors such as service, price, and ambience are not considered.
