Delicious yet so simple. Love how you they have the bar so you can out whatever and as much as you desire on your burger. Despite it being packed you get your order pretty quick
I love this place! You build your own burger and the atmosphere is the best! I love the rustic look of this place and it is the best burger I have ever had!!

One of the best burgers in AZ. The beef burgers are awesome, chicken burgers are great, fried zucchini are excellent. Fried mushrooms and onion rings are Ok.The restaurant itself is Ok, I think they should remodel and make sure to keep the tables clean. 

Negative would be that it is cash only. 

Go here if you want a really good burger and fried zucchini in a very casual restaurant.

Straight up best hamburgs in Tempe. Fresh beef grilled over mesquite charcoal  Simple and straight forward. No gimmicks.
 
I've been coming here since I was a kid with my family. 25 years. This Temple classic has stayed true to it's roots. 

One complaint. There is a guy who's always working there, usually on register, who is a complete A-hole. Aside from his crappy attitude the place is perfect. Thankfully you only have to deal with him for a minute while you pay or get frys.
Closed early, wouldn't serve me, not cool, not coming back. I've been going to the Chuck Box since I was a little kid - I'm an AZ native. This was very disappointing.

Best burgers around.  This place hasn't changed in decades, and why should it!  I studied here for finals between 1976-80, drinking beer, reading, eating, drinking, then walk back to apt in dry desert heat.  Great memories, and great burgers.

This place has the best burgers in town!  The best time to go is before ASU football games...it is packed though, be ready!  They have set up a second grill outside to help with the line.  Personally, ordering instead is worth the wait. 

One of the best things about this place is the bacon on their burgers.  Most places just throw a couple slices on the burger.  Not Chuck Box.  They have preformed pieces that are the shape of your burger.  This way, there is bacon in every bite.  YUM!  

Little known fact: they will add slices of green chile to your burger.  Just be aware they are actual slices, not chopped green chile so it will be slippery and add to the mess factor.

Be ready for the following things: cash only, parking sucks, and there may be a line (ESPECIALLY before games) so go early.

I went here with high expectations. Unfortunately they fell a bit short. It's a good place, but nothing to make a drive for. They only accept cash-- but it is reasonably priced. The food is good, it is sort of comparable to eating outside when your dad grills. All in all decent experience and decent service

I don't eat red meat very often but this place is worth it! It was a GOOD hamburger. It's a treat to come here. The meat is cooked well and you get to put on the fixings the way you like it. I've got no complaints.

Best burger in town.  And their veggie burger is awesome as well.  Rod and RAF are always super friendly, food is always good.  Bring cash or you'll have to use the ATM inside.  Very local spot, 45 years in business casie they are the best.

Same great food. Same great place for 100 years. Came here 30 years ago. Exactly the same today. Service is great. Food is great. Bring your cash thought. Nothing else accepted. And know what you want before you come in because the soups Nazi works here. No soap in the ladies room in the bathrooms are a little sketchy.

All I can say about Chuckbox is YUM. This is by far my favorite burger place in Arizona..maybe ever. I love the Tijuana Torpedo, which has a huge patty, green chiles and pepper jack cheese. I am a condiment whore, so having the option to pile my burger with whatever I want is a definite plus. By the time I'm done making my own burger, it's way too big to eat, so I have to dissect it into smaller portions..which is fun for me and highly entertaining for my friends.
The only reason it doesn't deserve my 5th star is for ambiance and speed. If you're in a hurry, chuckbox might not always be the best option. But if you're in the mood for a juicy well cooked burger then go there.. now.
and don't forget to stop by an ATM on the way, because this old school place only accepts cash.
I have a small appetite so I had the Little One burger with Chicken Tenders. Both were great and I would go back for the same thing for the rest of my semester at ASU

My Co worker buzz starts popping off at the mouth about how great this place is and blah blah blah so I say, "sure, let's try it..." watching the guy cook the burgers is kind of cool if you like watching burgers cook for an eternity. He finally hands you your burger and you have to grab your own fries, assuming you ordered them, then go to the condiment bar and build it yourself....in one hand I think that's pretty cool because you get to be creative and you know it's going to taste right but on the hand, I think to myself, you pay a decent price for a burger and they're doing the least amount of work to it. Over all it was ok. I wouldn't seek this place out but I'd go if everyone else was going.

I didn't really notice until my girlfriend said something, but it's totally true:  We, being from Southern California, are used to having a burger joint, a greasy hole in the wall, everywhere you go.  If you go to the bank, there might be a little burger stand inside.  When you wash your car, reach your hand through the window and hot wax and grab a beefy little snack.  

In Phoenix, not so much.  There ARE burger places, but most often, they're a chain:  In N Out, Five Guys, Smash Burger, Fat Burger, Whataburger, etc.... and while they all vary from being pretty damn good to at least not embarrassing, it's just not the same as going to some little hidden gem, tucked between two buildings.  You have great, gourmet places like Fez, but, like I said, it's not the same.

To be honest, it's something that you really start to miss about "home" even though it hasn't been home for you in a long, long time.

I've ridden past the Chuck Box quite literally, hundreds of times.  It's right on my way home from work tucked somewhere into my peripheral vision and had been ignored by my brain for YEARS.  It wasn't until my sister recommend we pop in before a movie that I even knew it was there.  I'd seen the sign, but my brain never connected the dots.

This place does help to fill that void.  Not 100% but the burgers were really, really good and I love the set-up to actually see your burger get made.  Then you add your own garnishes with their floating island thing.  The price ain't too bad and the decor inside is warm and cozy.

In fact, I plan on hitting it up tonight.
Great backyard bbq tasting burger. I have the bacon cheeseburger. I can't wait to go back and try something else

Absolutely one of the best flavored burgers I've ever had. Cooked over open flame, these charbroiled burgers are well worth the drive and the wait in line. 
The cooks keep the line moving and will take your order even when you are 10 people away from the grill. 
I got the double big one (2/3 lbs) with cheese and it was delicious.
They have burgers down pat. 
Also offer chicken breast (real ones, not patties) but seeing that the burgers are so good, I don't foresee trying the chicken anytime soon.

Delicious burgers grilled over charcoal and dressed the way YOU want it at the self-service condiment bar. One of top 3 best burgers I've ever had, and full of smoky grilled flavor goodness.  Very reasonably priced!  I made my way by bus on a long layover at the airport, and it was well worth the trip and time spent.

This place is really good for a good burger and fries. I would recommend them but make sure you have cash because they don't accept debt or credit but they do have a ATM. It's better then you typical fast food restaurants or five guys.

Flame broiled burgers a must when your craving some flesh in Tempe. Stopped by a few times to the burger joint and have not been disappointed. Those flame grilled burgers really have a different flavor to them. Anytime to you get a fresh charcoal grilled piece of flesh you'll never go wrong. 


Now when you enter the building its kinda a cluster F@@K but once you get your order in its made fresh in front of your eyes. You have a bar to add all your flavors to it. Now that bar is kinda nasty but they maintain it so dong be to freaked out.

I'm sure you'll enjoy the burger experience here if not the In & Out burger is down the street on Rural Road.
One dude, no name tag busting his ass on a busy Saturday. Other dude "norm" reading newspaper. Food is always awesome.

Great Burgers, Great Fries, Cold Beer, Great Fountain Coke, Great Staff.  The Burgers are so good you will wonder why do I eat burgers anywhere else?  Fries are the perfect. They have a build your own burger bar.  Cash only, but they do have an ATM.  Hours are great because they are open late 11pm Mon-Sat.  Treat yourself today.

I'm came to visit a friend all the way from Northern California and came across this place 5 years ago.  This place has the most quintessential burger that I've ever tasted, and I've had a lots of them.  And I have to say I hardly give high praise to restaurants because I am very critical and picky.  Without being organic, grass fed, or whatever, this place is amazing.  The burgers are cooked right in front of you and they season it just perfectly.  The size of the patty is perfect where it's not too thick to be considered a steak much like that of gourmet burgers nor is it too thin like the lame 5 Guys chain.  The condiment bar has nice and fresh ingredients.  I also have a theory that it tasted so good because the place is so locked in.  I don't remember much windows in the building and there was a lot of smoke inside because the grill was inside.  Maybe that's what made it extra smoky tasting.  I remember the burgers being so good I walked 2.5 miles from my hotel to eat it for lunch after having had it for dinner the night before.

A friend tipped me off on this place. What a find!  

I had the Tijuana Torpedo....a large beef patty that appeared to be stuffed with jalapeno cheese, then topped with grilled chilies. It was fantastic!  I added cheddar to mine and some fixings from their excellent condiments bar.  

Their fries are nothing special...I'll have to try the onion rings next time.

The building is small and dark, but this isn't a place you go for ambiance...just grub down man!  

The guys behind the grill were very helpful and are efficient with their jobs. 

The greatest thing about this place is how cheap it is.  We were able to get EXCELLENT burgers, fries and drinks for what it would have cost to go to a chain joint and order their top end burger.  AMAZING!

WARNING:  CASH ONLY!! (but there is an ATM in the building)
Simply the best burger in the Valley of the Sun. There is nothing else that can be said. Long live Juan!

I didnt have high hopes for this place, mostly because of how the burgers look. I know its shallow but steered me clear of other spots where the "locals" thought was a good place but wasnt. I came here on an afternoon and was taken aback the moment I walked in. The vibe is family friendly but in a distorted way. There's lots of paraphernalia on the wall, but it also doesnt feel super homey. Almost cafeteria like. The servers are god hearted but dont necessarily seem cheery. The layout is not fancy and all of your ingredients in the condiments bar seem like a cookout. The chuckbox is no gimmick. It truly is alive, wood burning fire that sparks outside of the grill. Theres even signs alerting you of the sporadic dangers of the fire. Standing by the chuckbox feels like IM getting a sunburn because its so hot! 

Nothing is wrong with what I described, but it wasnt reassuring until i ate my food. I almost wished I ordered a double juan with cheese and bacon, but a single 1/3 patty with cheese got the job done. To me, this is how Burger King should taste, The meat was moist, had a nice, even charbroil flavor, and worked well with all the other ingredients. I like that they toast the buns as well. Its also really cheap to eat here. My sandwich was under 5 dollars. Its cash only but its not that big of a deal. You could pay with quarters from your car console if you needed to. 

Overall, I was highly satisfied with this traditional, no-non-sense burger. They are nothing special, but for their price, they are good.

These are some of the best burgers I've ever had. Nothing too complicated, just good ingredients and perfectly broiled. Really, the cooks here know how to get the burgers just right, so props to them. When I eat here I just get cheese and bacon on my burger, but there is a condiment bar so you can load up your burger with whatever at no extra charge. This place is seriously my favorite burger joint out there, It makes me want to move back to Tempe.

The food was good, but after I got my food I waited ten minutes to pay with no one in line. They're cash only because they claim cards take up too much time, but even when I had cash it took a while because they're low staffed.
Best hamburgers. Best fries. Attention to detail is second to none. The patties are grilled on coals and fries are done in small batches. Ruthlessly efficient too.

I really enjoyed the food and the experience here.  Took some time to find parking nearby as I came during the dinner rush.  It was worth the wait.
They grill your burger right in front of you, which is a nice experience.   But more importantly, the burger tasted great!!!!   I had the Great Big One with jalapeno jack cheese, green chlies, and bacon.  It was very delicious.   I also had an order of jalapeno poppers.   Not too bad either - although they are obviously frozen and not made fresh.
Overall - I'd definately come back and recommend this place to others.  
Oh yeah - cash only, so bring some greenbacks.

Hands down the best burger in Tempe. Great flavor, fresh bun, and the fries and cold beer are the perfect compliment. You get to build your burger like you want it. The line goes much quicker than it might appear. Highly recommend this burger joint to the world.

Some bs going on here. Came in here thought I have enough money. Total came to 25.98$ and I poured myself an ice tea. I didn't find that .98cents so I told the dude if be wants to remove the drink
He actually removed the drink and throw it away infront of me! That's some bs s*** yo!! Like you seriously that griddy? Never ever coming back! Infact I'm sitting here rn and have no desire to eat this burger.

I went here in November 2003 and was not impressed at all.  The place is dark, dirty and dingy...my burger was small, overcooked (and I like things well done!) and not all that impressive - taste wise.  The fries/onion rings were about average and the cost was not as cheap as many people would like you to believe.

Now, keep this in mind - I had yet to try In-N-Out Burger when I decided I did not like The Chuck Box...once I had In-N-Out, it was all over for The Chuck Box.

I have no idea why anyone would go here with In-N-Out only a short distance away.  In-N-Out tastes better, it's cheaper and definitely cleaner...I wonder what frequent visitors to the Chuck Box think about it being dark as hell...maybe to cover up the grime?

I love this place! Great for ASU students because its so close to campus and its pretty cheap. It has its own parking lot too, which makes getting there a breeze. The workers are always friendly the place has a very casual atmosphere. My absolute favorite is the guacamole bacon burger. Their fries are good too (extremely important if you ask me) although I have yet to try the wings. Tip- they only take cash! An ATM is available for use in the store.

The differentiate factor of this burger place to other restaurant that offer burger is in their method of cooking patties which is through grilling using charcoal. 

Some people might not like their patties because it is only grounded beef. Seasoned salt is the only seasoning added while the patties is grilled. However, since it was grilled with charcoal, the meat has better aroma. In addition, you can ask for extra toppings on your burger like grilled bacon stripped, just look at their menu for further extra toppings.
For the condiment, you are free to choose because they have a table full of condiment. 

The problem with chuck box is inconsistency due to who is in charge of cooking the patties. I cannot give this place more than 2 out of 5 because I have tasted better burger than their burger. Yet, I like to go to their place for lunch because I like charcoal aroma on my meat.

Seriously...this place can't be beat. 

You watch them grill the burger to your specifications...fresh meat...fresh condiment bar...deep fried sides (which you KNOW you love)...and usually some ASU chicks to check out as you stuff your face. 

BEST BURGER IN TEMPE for my money! LOVE LOVE LOOOOVE THIS PLACE! Been coming here for years and work definitely continue to do so!

The Chuckbox is so tasty. I had the spicy chicken sandwich with a BACON WREATH and it was delicious. It's made to order on an open mesquite fire right in front of you so it tastes super fresh! They also have beer and wine if you're thirsty  and FYI it's cash only.

I think it's important to make a restaurant distinction here. If you appreciate dive-like settings with a) good food and/or b) good service, then you'll like Chuckbox. Oh, also being a meat-eater would help. If you're a sanitation-freak, I wouldn't come here.

Having eaten my lunch too early, I walked across the street from my office to the Chuckbox to give it a try. I stood in line and a nice man behind the grill took my order. A Big One, wheat bun. He then reaches into a bag o' buns and pulls it out with his bare hands, stabs it with burger and cheese identifying toothpicks, and tosses them on a flat grill surface to toast. Then he grabs his spatula and continues to flip.

The burgers move around the heat according to their done-ness, and the chicken goes where the burger was, the pineapple goes where the chicken was....get my point? If it wasn't cooked, maybe some would be worried about cross-contamination.

Anyway, the burger was AWESOME. I thought it was juicy and had good flavor. It looked like he sprinkled season salt on it--I could be wrong. I love a ton of condiments, so I really appreciated having a bar of them to myself. The lettuce was lacking--just a hacked up iceberg with some not so yummy parts, but everything else was what I wanted and more.

This place is all about expectations, and that's why I rambled so much about what some would love and what some would be terrified about. 

I'll come back and try the chicken.

Decided to check out this place before a show at Gammage and I am so very glad I did.  Had a hankering for a flame grilled burger and some fried zucchini recently and I can tell you that I will be dreaming about them in the near future.  The set-up was pretty awesome, got there just in time to beat the rush.  I think we showed up around 6ish and had a few people in line ahead of us.  The ordering process was easy and the food was delicious.  VERY reasonably priced for the amount of food you get.  I will definitely be back and it will be very soon.

really good charbroiled burger and cool old school place - but come on man canned briny green chilies really?!!
You in the SW where green chilies rule!

Great burgers. I love that I get to dress my own. Kept the line moving too!  Fries were good though the portion is on the small side. Probably good that they don't serve the giant sizes some chains so...
Excellent burgers. Unique environment that adds character to the meal. I come here everyday when in town for Spring Training.

I came here around lunch time and this place was packed. It is kind of "cafeteria style" where you place your order and then move down a line while you wait for them to cook up your burger. You move down a line and pick up your fries or other side items, then you get your burger and pay at the cashier. There is a condiments bar that features all the standard burger toppings. It can be a little chaotic trying to grab everything you want, and essentially make your burger. I felt really rushed since there was a ton of people there, and so it was kind of crazy getting everything. I would rather have the toppings already come on the burger instead of having to go through the hassle of doing it myself. The seating inside is somewhat limited, and very cramped. I liked this place overall though, and would definitely come back here. I thought that the burger was really excellent. The fries and fried zucchini were really good as well.
Absolutely great burgers. Onion rings were good.  Fries were not great, not sure how you can not make great fries. Love the condiment bar.

Slam Dunk!

I do NOT eat burgers.....

I ate here- the basic burger with cheese- it was great, tasted like a beef burger and my stomach is happy!

My favorite burger joint in az.  I don't throw that statement around, so try it for yourself.  The burger is cooked fresh, not frozen, over an open flame.  The onion rings are fresh and you can truly make it your way at the condiment bar.  Only bummer is that it's cash only, but nothing will keep me away from a chuckbox burger.  I wish they had drivethru.

Delicious and no BS. That's what I love about this place.

Know what your order is once you get in line -- there's no time to dilly dally (or the equivalent). The food is cooked for you right then and there on a grill. The spicy chicken breast sandwich is awesome. Burger, great. Has a self-serve condiment bar. Good prices too!!
Today was my first time at The ChuckBox and definitely is gonna be the first of many! Sure I'm coming back. Have it your way !! The burgers are just good as they look.

Phenomenal burgers and an Arizona State University Sun Devil staple!

Perhaps no other restaurant in the Tempe area embodies ASU more than Chuck Box.  Directly across the street from campus, it has been serving up some of the best burgers around for decades. 

The atmosphere is simple and the burgers are great.  

To borrow a tagline from a commercial I saw years back advertising a product I don't remember, "They're not great because they've been around for so long.  They've been around for so long because they're GREAT!"

This is defintely an interesting place. To start, the place is cash only and it wasn't a friendly place to be at for my first time there. I had to yell to order at lunch which was fine, just didn't understand the atmosphere. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and jalapeo poppers. The burger was awesome and tasted like a real home cooked burger.a nice refreshing taste aside from the other fast food joints and bulk processed fooderies. My only issue would be that there wasn't enough uniqueness to their food. The jalapeo poppers were pretty good and enough to come by, but the flavor was definitely lacking. This is a place you could go every once in a while to grab a quick bite away from other places you'd normally eat at for lunch. Ps. Parking is horrendous.

Holy crap that's a good burger!

Hot damn them's good french fries!

I'll be a monkey's uncle, that's some quick service!

Unfortunately, the condiment bar kinda grossed me out, and they were out of Coke.  Who runs out of Coke?  Still, KILLER burger, AND cheap, AND just a short walk from the light rail stop at Veterans and College.  Couldn't have asked for a better place to stop and grab a bite on the fly.

Really good burgers here.  I had the Tijuana Torpedo 1/2 Burger with green chili and jalapeno jack cheese.  Delish!  They grill it over flaming hot coals right in front of you.  It gives it unique mouth watering taste. I added in blue cheese dressing at the condiments bar to it.  Fresh.

The Sonoran Draft Root Beer is very good.  Comes in a cold mug.  I don't normally drink soda pop but occasionally I will drink this.

Cash only. ATM inside.

I love coming here when I'm in the mood for a really good burger.

This place makes a darn good burger.  I went here with a friend a couple days ago for the first time.  We went around 12:30 and didn't have any trouble finding parking but it was Memorial Day so there were less people around.  The seats inside were all full so that's usually a good sign.  We waited in line to order - they cook your food right there in front of you.  We actually saw them lift up the grill and stir up the charcoal underneath - pretty cool.  Burgers were made exactly as we ordered and they were legit!  Absolutely delicious - best burger I've had in quite a while.  They only take cash so be prepared.  (If you're not prepared they do have an ATM inside.)  They have a condiment bar after you pay which is where you add whatever you want to your burger (ketchup, mustard, mayo, lettuce, tomato, pickles, etc).  We sat outside on the patio (they have misters so it wasn't overly hot) and enjoyed our burgers.  It was a really good lunch and under $10 for the burger and fries.  Would definitely come here again!
The best chicken box in Tempe guys great foods The best service good price great clean food

So tasty! I've been here a few times and I'm always happy. They have a vegetarian option(It's cooked on the same grill as meat) and it's mighty tasty! They have pretty good options if you ask me. The only downside is it's no cash, BUT they conveniently have an atm inside. Try if you're in the mood for classic picnic burgers.

If you're looking for a great local burger joint, this is the place for you.  Make sure to bring cash, though, and a loud voice to yell your order in from the back of the line. 10/10 would recommend to friends and family.

Phoenix is known for many restaurants, but how many are considered a part of Tempe history?  Then again, is nearly 40 years considered history?  For students at ASU, it sure is!  It's more than double many of their ages.  

There are some parking spots though I've always found it easier to park elsewhere and just walk over.  The moment you walk into the restaurant, you instantly notice one long line that looks like it will take forever to order and receive your food.  The Chuck Box knows how to handle a big line.  They take orders as you stand a bit back into the line and keep the line moving along.  As you walk up, you get your drink and by that time, your food is already ready for you.  Looks can be misleading, and they certainly are in this case.  

There is a very nice condiment bar that everyone seems to enjoy after you get your food and leave the line.  It's nice to personalize the burgers, chicken, fries, or whatever else of the simple menu you choose to order.  There are little ones (burgers), big ones, and then great big ones.  I've never gone hungry with a big one or a double little one.  They're all tasty no matter what you order!

It's hard to imagine that this classic restaurant has been rejected by Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  That's the story around Tempe.  Perhaps it has to do with with them only accepting cash?  Or their choice in furniture (log ends as chairs), which I personally appreciate?

This is hands down, the best burger restaurant I've been to. The BEST burger I have eaten. 

You go in, order the size of your patty, and decide if you want one or two patties. You chose your bread and your cheese. Done... for now. You watch the patty being cooked right in fornt of you. 

You pay (cash only), take your burger to the ingredient table. Then you put in the ingredients that you want into your burger. Whatever you want, and how much you want of it... but play fair!

I used to go here on a weekly basis when I lived close to it, now I live further, but I still make sure that I visit my favorite burger place ever. 

200% recommended!

Charcoal grilled grub, small digs with old crates to sit on while you stuff your face, what's not to love about this place. I ordered a Tijuana Torpedo Burger w/fries and a Sonoran draft root beer, also got a Double Big One w/pepper jack chz to-go. My only knock is that the college SJWs working there are useless. Luckily the man working the grill runs the show. I'll be back, I enjoyed every bite.

A step back in time when MTV had just kicked off and we would stop in for a burger and a pitcher before class.  Well a ga-zillion years later the burgers are good and Norm the fry guy...cashier guy is a douche!

Its hard to dis on the Chuck but good lord, throw me a bone guys how-a-bout at least some semblance of customer service!!!!

Definitely one of the best burger places I have had the privilege to eat at. The building/atmosphere is a little quirky, but it's what makes chuck box the burger joint that it is. Considering the amount of food and the fact that the food is fresh/made to order, the prices are very affordable. You get to see your food made in front of you, which I always like. There is a condiment bar, which is nice because you can customize your burger. This place is cash only, so bring money. They do have an ATM if you forget. If you go to ASU or live in Tempe, this place is a must-go in rider to complete your experience!
hamburgessa heaven.  Guac and bacon on a burger is ingenious.  I do wish they had some curly fries or something but the burgers cant be beat.  Also, the condiment BAR is brilliant

The burger patty while thin was still juicy. I loved the condiment bar, put exactly what you want and how much you want of the burger. Tasted great. The fries were just average and the seating outside doesn't work well with shorts or skirts as it's a tree stump.
Chuck box getting only 4 stars is total BS. I have been going for over 20 years. Never has the food been less then excellent.

Yum!  How are there not more burger joints like this one?  Tell your order to the chef, watch him cook it for you.  Eat your delicious burger, or whatever beautiful piece of meat you choose, and enjoy their onion rings.  Beer+.  Food, done perfect!  Tvs.  I'm happy.  Thank you chuckbox!

I like burgers... a lot, and I eat them wherever I go!

I tried the Chuck Box because of YELP reviews, and I can't express enough appreciation for those YELPers who turned me on to this place.  FANTASTIC burger and rings.   I had the Tijuana Torpedo -- a most tasty concoction of wood-grilled meat, spicy cheese, and green chile pepper.  I've had many similar burgers but none quite so tasty.  I wish I had more frequent opportunity to be in Tempe.

Well I have yet to have the food but this past holiday weekend the wife and I just wanted to scope the place out. The smell was overwhelming and they make everything to order right on the grill. I can't wait to try the chicken sandwich and when I do I will update this review. Now be advised they only take cash and the parking could be a bit tricky. They draw tons of foot traffic because this establishment is located right in the heart of Tempe and ASU students I imagine are in abundance. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!!

Been going here with my dad since I was a kid.
On a recent trip to AZ I went here with a friend from high school and my little one. Everything was exactly as I remembered it-awesome! Love the do-it-yourself fixings and the whole experience is one to savor. Will continue to come back whenever I'm in town.

The Chuck Box is pretty delish. I always liked their burgers when I ate meat. I wanted to write this review because I was EXTREMELY impressed with their veggie burger, and when I looked at reviews myself, there weren't any pics of the veggie burgers.

I had asked what was in it, and the employee didn't really seem to know and said "carrots". I was worried because I've had some funky veg burgers with shreds of carrots in it. Anyways, I was definitely worried. Buuuuut when I got my burger and bit in, it was delicious!! It had a really nice faux meat taste, rather than that vegetable taste. My partner actually liked my burger more than his real meat one! We were both really impressed with it.

Plus the fries are always on point.

Definitely enjoyed this place during my time in Tempe. I do have to say that the place has a unique Western style, and that I liked how you can watch them make the food as you wait in line. They have a nice system for you to put different types of condiments (of your preference). That being stated,  I felt that it was a standard solid burger, and is a good place to be at to hang with some friends for lunch.

I have never had a better burger than the burger at Chuck Box. I try so hard to recreate the awesomeness that is the combination of the lean 80/20 beef (bought from a local Scottsdale butcher, and hand pounded using old Mexican preparations), crisp greens (or grilled green chillies/pineapple), and lightly toasted bun; but my efforts are futile. It cannot be done. I have to admit, I worked at this run-down looking little shack, but it wasn't until I recognized the "flavor" that I knew I had to be part of a legend. Don't expect a cute little smile when you walk in the door, and don't wear your sunday best. Rest assured that anything you order will be the best you'd ever have. A guide to ordering at The Chuck Box: White or wheat? Chicken (Plain, Hot n' Spicy, BBQ, or Teriyaki) or Beef (Little Once (1/5lb), Big One (13/lb), or Great Big One (1/2lb))? Cheese (American, Swiss, Pepperjack, or Cheddar)? Bacon? Green Chile? Pineapple? Guac? (believe it or not you then dress it up yourself at the best condiment bar). And on the SIDE: Fries, Onion Rings, Mushrooms, Zucchini, Jalapeno Poppers, Chicken Strips, Chili? ......Man I want some right now....

This is arguably the best burger joint in the entire state of Arizona. They use fresh meat and vegetables. The only thing I don't like as much, is the condiment island which can sometimes be a little messy. Other than that it is absolutely amazing.

The burgers remind me of Micnics, remember Micnics?

This is what I don't like about the place:
1)  standing in a long ass line and having someone yell at me to yell my order back at them
2) the buffet of fixings that allows you, flies and everyone else and their filthy fingers to make their own burger
3) its dirty
4) I smell like a grease ball when I leave
 
I want to kick back and relax when I eat a meal, this place is too much work for too little pay off.

!!! ~ CASH ONLY ~ !!!

This place is an absolute HOLE IN THE WALL - but in the good kind of way.  There is no diet menu here.  The Chuck Box is for Carnivores!

Very casual, very open, great outside seating and perfect atmosphere.  they sell beer to help wash down your tasty burger.  I'm hooked!

Parking is limited and the lunch crowd borders on almost our of control.  Get there early!

Pros
-Pretty great food, great burgers
-fair pricing
-cool condiment bar

Cons
-cash only
-would like fresh french fries, zucchini, and mushrooms instead of reheated pre-made frozen stuff

Where should I start!?  Hmmm...

Well I was told to come here years ago from a friend, but never traveled my way down to the Mills Ave. much anymore since I'm way past my 20's.  However, it was always on my mind and now; Bam! I did it!  

The Chuck Box I guess has been around for ages, not my age apparently.  The place itself is a dive.  Made out to look like it's right out of a pioneer wagon with boxes as chairs.  Seating is limited so arrive and be prepared to wait or pickup and go.  The burgers are made from scratch literally.  It's a "build your own burger" place so add toppings by asking the chef.  Overall, the burger is perfect.  Best firewood grill burger I've had!  Mesquite firewood is what they used. The burger is nice and juicy with a smokey scent!  I went lightly on the toppings since the burger itself is so big!  Ordered me a side of zucchini fries and I'm golden!  

In the end, I can be a burger snob, but The Chuck Box impressed me.  I don't care for "build your burger" places, but I'll let this one pass with an A grade. - Enjoy

Awesome laid back atmosphere with made-to-order burgers! The condiment station makes it easy to design your perfect burger to pair up with the onion rings, jalapeo poppers or zucchini, which are some of my favorites. Give it a try, and don't forget to bring cash.

Best Burgers Period.

I no longer order burgers anymore due to them never standing up to a Chuck Box burger. I always get a little one and I can barely finish it but I push myself every single time because they are worth the pain of over eating. The onion rings are also a must. I still need to try their chicken sandwich but it is just so difficult due to their burgers being that good. Honestly I don't know how many times I can say this but they are the BEST BURGERS EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've heard A LOT about the Chuck Box over the years, so I finally decided it was time I gave it a go.

Atmosphere-wise, nothing to write home about. It has a similar vibe to the Original Hamburger Works, with a wagon full of condiments and a similar order, watch them grill your burger, pay setup. The place looks old, which I guess is part of it's appeal. They only accept cash for payment, which is kind of lame in this day and age.

The burger itself was good. Good like a home-cooked burger on the grill would be. For $8 and some change, I'm not in a rush to hurry back here, but I won't say that I'll never return. Overall, I just didn't feel it lived up to the hype.

Family member LOVED the the burger. I liked it but felt it's more of a place you to eat at opposed to getting to go (which is what we did). Next time we are eating there. Burger was cooked a harder than I would have liked. I believe I probably could have had them take if off the fire sooner but I was busy boxing up the burger fixings. Onion rings were good but only one serving so don't plan on really sharing with anyone. Lol all in all great experience. Would definitely eat there again.
The best burger I had at Phoenix... Must visit place for burger lovers. The ambience is also awesome. Dont forget to take some cash (They dont accept cash).

Chuck Box burgers are hands down one of the best burgers in town.  The place is very dive-y but the food cannot be beat.  Beware that this joint is CASH ONLY, although an ATM is right by the door.  Burgers (and other assorted items) are cooked right in front of you after you order on a charcoal grill.  After your food is ready you are free to help yourself to the condiment bar.  There's also plentiful outdoor seating which is great for people watching!
Legit yumminess. Tijuana torpedo is my pick and if i need a change i do the chicken breast.

One serious burger. The chuck box is an experience  in itself. From Juan asking whatcu want the second you walk in the door to paying only with cash, this place rocks. As an ASU alumni, I went here all the time when I was on campus with friends. Occasionally on the weekends we'd have beer and burgers here, can't be beat. The line an get pretty long but that's because the food is good. If you order chicken, expect it to take a while longer than the burgers, and get out of line but keep an eye on it. I read a review from someone calling the place dirty, which is funny because they must not get out much. The place is not dirty, it is old and authentic, and clean as it is going to get. If you're in Tempe and hungry and have cash and want a burger, come here. It's not fast but it's delicious.
Only Restaurant with a burger named after me... "The Great Big One" get you one!! Good food cool people!

Best Burger on Earth.  Yep, it's a dive and yep, it's a dark dingy place. But I've never had an overcooked or under cooked burger.  They've always made my perfectly and the orders always come out quickly.  

Bring cash and walk away very full.
Best burger you've ever had in your life. If you disagree, you either know something I don't or your palate has no business writing reviews here.

I can't say enough about this spot. It's a simple, down to earth, no frills burger joint. But at the same exact time, it's mind-blowingly amazing!! It's constantly busy so give yourself some time when you decide to head there. You enter, and there's usually a pretty hefty line. But be patient an just wait. It'll all be well worth it. When you decide which burger you're going for, they'll ask you on what kind of bun and how you'd like your party cooked. They charbroil their burgers made to order the good ole fashion way - over an open flame. Also, they're CASH ONLY. So make sure you've got some one you. But if not, there's an ATM inside. All the condiments are presented to you "salad bar" style and they also make some amazing fried zucchini bites and onion rings. If you're craving a great burger, give this place a try. You're welcome. ;)
one of the best burgers in az, just get the big juan and thank juan after! order it, then they grill it and makes your mouth water waiting n watching. then pile your own stuff on at the bar.

A Sun Devil staple! Located just across the street from ASU's campus, this place is always busy. Burgers grilled to order with a well stocked  and clean condiment bar. Grilled peppers, guac or bacon. Lots of yummy options here.  Yes, you may leave with the smokey aroma of the grill but that's just going to make everyone else jealous. This place is consistently good and one of the few places on University or Mill to survive the standard turnover rate of the area!  That should tell you something. 

Tip - Don't forget they are cash only!
Try the big Juan! This is the staple burger of ASU. Don't let the shack like appearance of the restaurant fool you!
Another epic  Tijuana torpedo. Always a great burger here.  Been enjoying Chuck Box burgers since I worked at the one that used to be in Scottsdale many years ago.

The most simple, basic burgers you can think of.
I mean that in the absolute best way. Sort of a 'salad-bar-build-your-own' feel to it.
They give you the meat of your choice, the cheese of your choice, and a bun, and let you do what you want to it.
Cash only, so heads up on that.
Delicious.

Best hamburgers I've ever had. Gets busy during the school year, so I try to go at night. Everything on the menu it's fantastic. My personal favorite is the Tijuana Torpedo. The green peppers are incredible with the cheese and it's so good that the condiments are made into a side salad instead of going on the burger. I would recommend this to every burger enthusiast.

This place is iconic ASU! As soon as you get there you can just feel the classic vibe! The building has clearly been there for a long time and with good reason. The food is fantastic and the staff is nothing but excellent. I highly recommend trying the fried mushrooms! 
Great when my dad was a student and great now as a student. A must if you go to ASU or even just visiting.

Had lunch here with our family. This place is nothing fancy, but the burgers are excellent. You sit on wooden boxes for chairs. The building looks like a dumpy shack. The burgers are cooked over an open grill using real charcoal briquettes. The staff here is very friendly. Wished I lived closer to the place so I could go more often!

Famed for their burgers, they also grill the best chicken sandwiches I have eaten in my life. So dang succulent. The university-adjacent location means that parking can be difficult, waits can be lengthy, and seating can be impossible. Stop in when they're not too busy however, and you'll be glad you did. Pro tip: they will add a grilled green chile or a grilled pineapple to any sandwich! Cash only.

At The Chuckbox, you are in the grill. You are a part of it, well at least that's what it feels like in the summertime coming here. I was reminded of an old tinder pile of wood, in case you were looking for the place and could not find it. I honestly do not know how they have managed to not go up in flames yet in all of the time they have been here. They have misters outside if you want to brave the desert heat and sit on the patio.

Why would I review a place that has over 100 reviews? because then you can read a recent review instead of one from 2009. I am a vegetarian so I don't know if my review is baloney or what, but I assure you my gardenburger was the bomb. Draft beer anyone? My partner is a meat eater/carnivore and he assured me his burger was seared perfectly on the outside and very juicy on the inside. I could not for the life of me get him to shut up about the damn burger. I tried talking about musicians, porn, firearms, all to no avail! 

I really like the condiment station where you can do it yourself and pile on whatever it is that you pile on your burger. I feel like I walked into old west with hammered copper top tables and wooden crate seating. You can watch your burger being grilled and it is not frozen beef but fresh chuck. The fries were good and although I did not get the onion rings, they looked excellent on other people's plates. Just make sure you sit next to the air conditioner.

I went to ASU and I never ate here. So I was probably the only student who didn't follow the tradition. 

Today it was super busy. I came here during the lunch hour. I had the bacon cheeseburger. You call out your order while you wait since the line is so long. The burger was a decent size. This place is cash only but there is a ATM on sight. What was cool is they have a condiments bar for your burger. I thought this was neat. My bacon cheeseburger was pretty good. I ate the whole thing. Prices were decent too. I wouldn't get the onion rings again. They were just okay. There was a man making sure the tables were clean too. 

So my cherry was finally popped for this place. I will  go again for round 2

The burger was good and I liked how they had a buffet table full of toppings and condiments where you can customize your burger. However, it being my first time there the place was a little intimidating so one tip to newbies out there is to not stand in front of the menu because that is the line. Right when you walk in, the menu is above on the right. Make sure to walk further into the restaurant so that the worker knows you aren't ready to order and so that you won't block the way of other customers who are trying to get in line.

This is the best place to come if you are in the mood for a homemade-tasting burger. They cook over a large charcoal fire, making it taste like something my dad would cook up in the backyard on his grill, but BETTER! So delicious and very decently priced. 

Make sure you know what you want when you go inside...they will ask for your order even if you are far back in the line. They move very quickly here!

Minus 1 star for not taking debit/credit cards

Tasty burgers, fun atmosphere, cold beer.

Yay!

You're going to leave smelling like smoke but also feeling very satisfied. When I was visiting from NY, this place was recommended by a local, and it was definitely the write choice. The burgers were fresh and had a backyard BBQ feel to them. I ended up ordering another one after my first and even though I could barely move, it was worth it!

I tried the Tijuana Torpedo here and wow, probably one of the best burgers I've tasted. Everything is made to order, staff is cool, and just the atmosphere is completely laid back. They do only accept cash though just to make sure there are no long waits.
Pretty good basic burger, add green chiles to make it a great burger. I highly recommend this place & there burgers. But it's cash only so hit the atm first.

The Chuck Box is a Tempe staple that's been going strong for 45 years.  I remember eating here in elementary school and loving it.  Hubby was craving a burger and I thought this place might be good to revisit after all those years.   It still looks exactly the same as it always has and the burgers are still delicious.  You can really taste the wood coal in the burgers.  Anywhere I can add as many pickles to a burger as possible is a great place in my book.  Hubby was super happy with his burger and frosted glass of root beer.  If you're looking for a simple and tasty burger at a good price, get your cash together and try this place.
Chuck box has the best cheese burger & fries next to WhataBurger. Love there grilled burgers, just like the back yard BBQ. Just someone else us cooking!

I've been coming here since I was a little girl with my parents.  They have the best hamburgers here that you dress up the way you want.  You can choose from a little one (regular size) and big one (big) and a great big one (HUGE).  Of course whatever condiments you want too.  They have seating outside and the whole place has an old west feel to it.  They only accept cash, but it is totally worth taking a trip to the ATM. Oh yeah, get the zuchini, soooo GOOD!

Best burgers in town????? Yeah, I'm gonna have to agree with other Yelpers. I've stopped by a couple times since I stumbled onto this place and I'm a fan! I will quickly refer anyone here for one of their delicious hamburgers. A couple options in patty size, cheese experience and additional toppings on the grill. A couple fried vegetable options to choose from, zucchini & fries hit the spot for me. A full condiment bar to top off your burger to its perfection. Not much more you can ask for.....

FYI-They only take CASH so bring sum chedda. They do have an ATM tho in case you forget. Also, good food can sometimes equal a bit of a long line to get up to the grill and with being smack dab in the middle of ASU this place can get packed. Have a prospect grab you some seats is my recommendation while you drool in line for a delicious bite to eat

I have got to say that this is my favorite place for a burger period just make sure you've got cash although they do have an ATM on site. I love everything about this place: the atmosphere, location, food, and the people that work there. This is the kind of place that doesn't try to be something it's not. I've never had a burger that wasn't incredible and I absolutely love watching the guy behind the grill make the burgers.

If you're looking for a great burger with that classic charcoal taste this is absolutely the best place to go. You have to check it out.
unpretentious dining area with really juicy mesquite-grilled hamburgers. cash only. dont expect any veggies or any healthy sides other than guacamole

Wow. You know, I already have a favorite burger joint in town, and it's not The Chuck Box. I went here tonight because it was it's a few miles closer than my normal favorite and wasn't up for the drive. I'm glad I did. I was a bit skeptical of how my burger would turn out because I saw it being cooked, and in my foolish opinion I thought it was overcooked. Nonetheless, I made my burger up the way I like it (they have a condiment bar, as I'm sure you've read), with tomatoes, ketchup, mayo, and lettuce. When I took my first bite, I got the charred edges of the burger, but also a mouthful of delicious beef, and realized it wasn't burnt, the cook meant to do that. The patty wasn't quite as thick as I prefer, but the flavor was excellent. 5 stars, and a very close second for best burger in town.
In my opinion the best BURGER in Tempe! Cash only is probably the only negative

If you're looking for a fast burger then this is not your place.  They cook the burgers right in front of you so it takes a while.
The food was good, the ambiance was rustic.  The taste was good, although it would have been nice to get a higher quality bun. I felt that the customer service was ok, not great.  I loved that they have a condiment bar.
I wouldn't go our of my way to go there, but if in the area I would go back.
TIPS: go during odd times as rush hour is packed and don't forget your cash.  No cards accepted.
I think the burger in chuck box is very delicious. In addition, the fruit and some topping are fresh. You can get free drink refills. You should try it.

This place is so good! It doesn't look like much, but it is! You stand in line, order, watch your food cook and pick up your food, all before you get to the register and pay. There's a big middle bar of toppings. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger which was delicious. Also, I got an order of onion rings which were AMAZING. Lightly battered, not overly greasy, they were cooked perfectly. I would've ordered 2 orders of them had I known they were so good. The pricing is also very reasonable but it is cash only.
Best burgers in town, better read the menu you get here. The line gets big and the order taker is ready for you to yell at him with your choice of burger. Well worth the price and wait.

Best burgers in town. A real Tempe staple. I love this place so much. Grew up on it. If you are in town visiting, Chuck box is a must stop. Great veggie burgers too if you ate vegetarian like my friend.

The Juan and only! Head toward ASU/Mill Ave and bask in the Mesquite Grilled splendor. 

The Chuck Box is truly a long standing and radiant gem in the valley. I've been going here since the mid-80's when I was at ASU. Very little has changed and that's a good thing.. a very good, deep-down thing. 

This uncomplicated burger experience will leave you satisfied and pining for your next trip... as it has for me over the last 40 years. The are certain foods in the valley that would be unmistakable in a blind taste test. A Chuck Box burger is one such food. The flavor of the meat, cooked over mesquite, is exceptional. 

Advice: 

It's a cash-only establishment, so bring some... or pay the ATM fee.
I'm partial to the Great Big One with Pepper Jack on Wheat and a side of Fries.
Split a pitcher with the homies.

Wash, rinse, repeat as required to sustain/improve your happiness.

I've been eating burgers for nearly 50 years, I've eaten them across the country and around the world, hands down there isn't a better burger on the planet.
Great portions cooked on a grill over a mesquite pit for an unbelievable combination of charring and wood smoke that makes me drool just thinking about it.
Ambiance, decor: well, pull up a barrel stool and put the burger in your mouth and tell me that stuff matters.
On a personal note, I've been eating at this place since the mid 80's, nothing much has changed, and I'm glad.   If you want the process at 5-guys, or the posh of Fudd Ruckers, go eat at one of those places so I don't have to wait as long for my burger.

My first Chuck Box experience was in 1989.  It is good to see a business that has maintained through the "redevelopment" of the area around ASU.

Fast-forward to my return to the Valley in 2011...and in cruising through my old stomping grounds, observing that ALL the favorite spots (Mama's Pizzaria, Ozzie's Warehouse, 6 East Lounge and Long Wongs) are no more.  The Chuck Box, complete with rusty-appearing roof, still stands, though.  It is gratifying to see the puffs of smoke from the grill.

On walking in, the decor has not changed.  The tables still have copper tops, and when you sit inside, you are sitting on wooden crates.  The condiment bar is certainly one of the best I have seen in a burger joint.  It makes customizing the favored double burger with cheese and bacon SO easy!

The prices are good, the beer is cold, and the onion rings are certainly up to par.  The only thing that has changed (and maybe it is because I am 20+ years beyond my first visit) is that students seem to get faster service.

I was in Phoenix for an appoint men on 10Feb, and I was going to meet a friend the night before, she suggested the Chuck box, for both it's price and location to her home.  (She is also a former ASU student,)
I liked the building as soon as we pulled up.
Inside was a wood fired grill  I ordered my Great Big Bacon Cheese Burger.  It took a while to make, but they cooked it it right in front of me.  I ordered my onion rings crispy, and the cook shouted to the fry cook.
I had my drink onion rings and burger, now over to the condiment bar to get topping for the burger.
My friend suggested we sit outside, as it was warm night in Tempe.  
It didn't take long to chow down on a very good burger and rings.  I will be back the next time in the metropolitan area!

So I was back at the Chuck Box and I noticed something I had not before...

Most restraunt bathrooms have a sign that says: "Employees must wash hands" and I have a standard joke about what a pain it is to have to wait for an employee to come by to wash my hands, I'm perfectly capable of washing my hands ha ha ha. 
But the, otherwise unattractive bathrooms at the Chuck Box have a clearly worded sign that says: "All Employees must wash their hands before returning to work!"

Good burgers! Grammatically clear sanitary signage! What's not to like!
Just a regular good burger you can make at home, wasn't too impressed. Not saying it was bad just wasn't to die for like I expected

How do my husband and I convince ourselves that visiting family in PHX will be painless? We fool ourselves with a fire grilled burger and an ice cold beer at the Chuck Box. 

It is a classic burger, experience and I'll always pay a visit before I say hi to mom.

our incredible light rail adventure on v-day headed east after a stop in central phoenix. yay for me! that means lunch at the chuckbox for the first time in at least 7 years, probably longer. 

we could smell it from a quarter mile away. we could almost taste it when we  got to the familiar wooden patio. and we couldn't get it fast enough once we ordered ... damn, dude, we  l o v e  the chuckbox - maybe even more today than when we went to asu. juicy burgers, tasty chicken, thick bacon and a (kinda sketchy) condiment bar with lots o' fun stuff to class up your burger with. this place is all around good. you just can't say enough nice about it. they've got a system, and the system works. you'll get what you order and it will be super fresh and tasty. i can't give them less than 5 stars. i love you chuckbox. i will be back to see you again soon.

We love this place for a tasty burger and fries or onion rings. Add their local root beer to wash it all down! The place is unpretentious and is interested in serving you good food. If you want to he catered to or sit in a brightly lit and romantic place, go somewhere else. Otherwise just enjoy this ASU area classic and bring cash or your ATM card to get cash as it is a cash only establishment.
The burgers are delicious. Popped in during lunch to satisfy a craving and was not disappointed! Bring cash! There's an atm here with $2.00 fee. You have to try if in Tempe.

The Chuck Box is an excellent place to go to for anyone looking to grab a quick, yet completely satisfying and incredibly tasty burger. With a variety of sizes to choose from it will surely fulfill anyone's hunger, no matter how big your appetite is. 

Also, the food is prepared in front of you, so you can watch the entire process. 
Minus one star for having a rude and uncharismatic server with absolutely no personality. But all in all, great food, great place.

While the interior appears to follow the name of what you would expect a chuck box to look like, I wasn't at all thrilled with the wait, or the product.
I went with a hot dog (yes I know it's not their specialty) but really a hot dog served on a hamburger bun? That info should be disclosed before you order. Why would I want a long hot dog on a round bun? Not at all appetizing either and the fries needed salt. A popular condiment that should be cooked into the food.
You wait in line to order which can take a while, pay cash only and condiments are on a salad bar type table. 
Hubby had a burger which was great in flavor but unspectacular otherwise. 
I think the biggest draw for this place is the location and price. It's worth going to but be careful. Hubby also almost choked on 2 toothpicks that were somehow in his sandwich. He didn't want to say anything about it so it never got mentioned but first impressions mean a lot.

The Chuck Box is one of the best burgers you will find in the Phoenix metro. 

The style is kick back, with wood chips on the floor and a pick-up counter, so you can never feel "too scrubby" to go to the Chuck Box. And the condiment bar is top notch, which is always major points for me. If anyone has been to the Original Hamburger Works near downtown, they know what I'm talking about, and this one is comparable. 

Fantastic hangover food and really good the rest of the time.

I finally made it to The Chuck Box and I am very glad I did! Like other reviewers stated, the ordering/paying system is screwed up, but ultimately, I'm here for a delicious burger and fries! Make that a Double Big Burger with bacon and American cheese. It took a little while, but good things come to those who wait. And man, was it good. I'm ranking it at either second or third in my Best Burgers of Phoenix list. The Chuck Box grills their burgers over an open flame, giving it a great flavor.

I get people's issue with a fixin's bar, but when I was there it was in decent shape. I'm willing to forgo my slight germaphobia in order to get whatever I want, the way I want it, on my burger. Also, the midwesterner inside me loves the fact that they offer free ranch dressing for all your French fry dipping pleasure. (Please note: I'm not at all from the midwest)

I went with a friend after a day trip to Sedona for some hiking. We both heard great things and wanted to give it a try. After an impromptu decision to head directly to Chuck Box, we made a second impromptu decision to make it a Tempe burger tour and give Lobby's a try as well. Both were great, but I'm giving the nod to Chuck Box, while my friend voted for Lobby's.

Ventured here for lunch  today with my good friend Austin. Another successful lunch! 

The Chuck Box knows exactly who their customers are, exactly what they offer and they execute with precision. Charcoal grilled burgers, fries or onion rings and a condiment bar with the essentials to finish off your meal how you like it. A home bbq weekend when ever you're in the mood.

It's simple, it's effective and above all, it's good.

Their cash only policy is a minor annoyance that you quickly forget after sinking your teeth into the fresh-off-the-grill meal.

I honestly don't get it. 
Long lines, weird service, and literally store bought buns out of a plastic bag. The burgers are okay, but nothing that great. It tastes like a typical 4th of July bbq. 
That said, the onion rings are pretty darn good, and the smell really does draw you in.

This place is so good! Be prepared for a bit of a wait because they start cooking your burger when you order it. You can stand in line and watch them as they grill up your delish meal. Oh and be prepared, this is a cash only restaurant! They make up for this slight inconvenience with great food and a condiment bar. That's right, you can put what ever you want onto your burger!

The Chuck Box is dark. Very dark. Even in the day time it feels like night in that place. This doesn't help when it comes time to put condiments on one's burger. I am skeptical as to how well the condiment bar looks in good light, which may explain the choice of lighting. Still, grinning and bearing it, I load up my veggie burger with appropriate toppings and, usually with fried zucchini in hand make my way to one of the very uncomfortable seats.

Every time I go to the Chuck Box I feel as if there is going to be something wrong with the food, and this something is being concealed from me by the lack of lighting. Yet, each time I go I have a delicious veggie burger or grilled chicken sandwich. My friends have also enjoyed "real" burgers there as well. 

Maybe it's best they keep the lights dim, but the food tastes so good there may be nothing to fear after all.

a favorite spot when visiting ASU.
great burgers and fries!

For a burger joint that caters to the local college kids in Tempe, this place is above average. You should go to The Chuck Box just to experience the way they cook their burgers in front of you while you're in line. 

Also above average: the price. Expect to spend a little more than the average burger when you come here, but it's well worth it. And considering the venue is local, it's an even better excuse to get your booty here on your lunch break.

We all have our favorite burger haunts, and the Chuck Box is a favorite of mine, especially since it was one of the first, well, dives I ever went to for a burger.  I finally got a chance to go back there after several years' absence.

I'm sure that when it was built (which I don't know when that was, the Box was a veteran burger joint when our family moved to Arizona in the early 80s), it was on the north side of Arizona State University, but as ASU has grown, it's probably more accurate to say that it's now kind of in the middle of ASU.

In any case, the Chuck Box is basically a burger shack, emphasis on the shack. It's old gnarled wood, and it sports a definite sloppiness in construction that's the hallmark of a "shack". Actually, sometime in the 80s I remember the place had a bit of a makeover, in which they added some windows (greatly increasing the light level), added some ventilation (greatly reducing the smoke level from the grill), and removed a lot of the accumulated crap on the walls and ceiling. I think I liked it better before, but I'm not a building code enforcer, either.

But, even though the random mementos on the wall are interesting (including such oddities as a picture of Ronald McDonald signed "Even Ronald likes to go to the Box!"), the real features of the Chuck Box are the several foot long charcoal grill, several Frialators, and a big giant condiment bar (that says "Have it your way... but play fair!"). Basically, it's all about having a grilled sandwich, with the main features being the "Big One" 1/3 lb burger, and the "Great Big One" 1/2 lb burger. They also have a variety of grilled chicken sandwiches and the like. All the burgers are available on white or wheat buns, with several cheeses (including pepper jack), bacon, or even fried peppers.

Finally, you can round out your burger with the free condiments bar. Nothing terribly elaborate here, but it's got a decent array of your basic burger toppings (onions, pickles, pickled jalapenos, mustard, etc).

Pros:

1. This is a seriously good charbroiled burger done right. I opted for my normal, a Big One with swiss and grilled peppers, with a bunch of onions, mustard, and jalapeno piled on.

2. Free well-stocked condiment bars should be the norm at any burger joint...

3. The fries (a.k.a. Chuckbox Potatoes) are quite good here, with a nice crunchy exterior and a mashed-potato-like interior. Seriously, I like the fries here.

Cons:

1. Being in the middle of ASU, parking can be an issue, and on occasion, it's pretty crowded.

2. If it's not sunny out, this place can be danker than Moe's Tavern.

All-in-all, I was glad to see that one of my favorite burgers for over 20 years is still a solidly dependable burger.

Completely over rated.  I've been there about 7 or 8 times and never had a fantastic burger.  It's not bad.......it's just not great.  Maybe it's because my childhood was never a memorial day BBQ kind of childhood, that I think thin burgers are pretty meh.  They just never have that juicy medium rare middle that I long for.  Lines are too long during peak hours and you wind up waiting just as long on off peak hours.  It's hot.  The chairs suck.  The fact that the bathrooms are outside for some reason grosses me out.  

It's not that I will never eat there.  I just won't go out of my way to eat there.

Overall 3.5

This was my first time coming here. A couple locals recommended my sister and I come to this place. We looked at the reviews and had to try it out. The location is right next to the ASU campus. It has an old western look on the outside. On the inside is a casual look with a condiment bar right in the middle. I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger. The burgers were instantly put on a grill that broils the meat giving you that family BBQ type of look and taste. I was excited to eat my burger the minute I saw it cooking on the grill. Once the burger is cooked you can put whatever condiments you want on it. The burger was good it tasted like a typical burger cooked on a grill. I just felt like I needed to have another because he portions weren't to big. Overall I did enjoy trying this place out definitely recommend eating here if your in Tempe.

They have the best burger ever! I have yet to find another place that has burger like chuckbox's. I sure miss this place since I don't live there anymore. Only drawback is that it's cash only, do make sure to bring cash! I love my burger with pineapple, yummy!!!

I used to come to this burger joint a lot. Been coming here for almost 10 years. I moved out of town but every time I'd come visit, I always make sure to stop by the chuck box. I love this place. However my last visit really turned me off about this place. I took my boyfriend to this place since I've been raving about it. While I was getting condiments one of the guys that worked there made a sly transphobic comment towards me then tried to cover it up and yelling across the room at his coworker. I was very disappointed that it ruined my good experience from this place from the past. Will never come to this place again and will not be recommending this place anymore to people I know.

Whoooo child! I would've gained so much weight if I went to ASU. That Torpedo burger looked legit but my appetite was not up to the challenge. 

Burgers were juicy and cooked to order, topping bar had everything we needed to load our burgers.

Jalepeno poppers were perfect popper size and onion rings were nice and crispy.

I left here full, not stuffed, satisfied and a fan of this delicious little establishment. I just left and already I can't wait to go back. The burger was cooked to perfection and the fries and poppers were a lovely addition to my meal.

The absolute best burger i've had. Hands down. The chicken sandwich is great too! Don't skip out on this place if you're in the mood for a burger.

Also, like people said--- they only take cash. Be careful!

The Chuck Box is a staple for any Arizonan as its been at the Tempe location for over 30 years.  Sadly the Scottsdale location (Taken over by Oreganos in about 2003) was much closer to where I was raised. 

If you are a fan of IN&Out and 5 Guys, and want to change it up, I think this place is a great place to go.

The burgers are some of the best chuck you will find, grilled over mesquite wood which gives it a savry smoky flavor.  They cook the burgers right in front of you if you desire to wait in line, or they will just yell out what order is up while you grab a seat.  Toppings are self serve and fresh.  The burgers come in sizes of "a great big one" (3/4 lb), big one (1/2 lb), and a little one (1/3 lb).  Make sure to order the fries extra crispy, though onion rings and fried zucchini are local favorites.

I recommend anyone visiting Phoenix and claims to be a hamburger aficioando, to try this place.  Be mindful of the Cash Only concept.

5 star burger for sure. Made to order over flames in front of your face. Boom. If that's not enough, the chicken and the beef patties  are fresh, fat and delicious. 

Toppings are done buffet style and you sit on a wooden box. Lol serious. The chairs throughout are wooden boxes. 

Highly recommended!

Perfectly portioned burgers and fries for under $10! I got the bacon cheeseburger and loaded it up with all the fixins at the condiments station. 

Really cool atmosphere with crates to sit on instead of your basic chairs. This place really knew how to dazzle me. 

Only pay with cash so bring those hundiessssss!!!

Local Favorite! Grate burger cooked on a Mesquite Wood Fire Grill who could ask for more. 
The meat is good quality not the best of the best but good. The portion size is very good and you place your own toppings so how can you go wrong.  This place has been there forever serving the Big Juan and has been successful so they must be doing something right. That something right is their Wood Grill that perfectly cooks your burger to order.

I've been either living in Arizona (in the 80's) or for the last 25 years coming to Arizona and never miss a chance to stop at Chuckbox. It was said in the eighties that John Wayne would have killed for one of these great burgers and it's still true today. They tend to run a little too short on staff at night (and you'll get to hear Charles bitch) but the taste of that mesquite grilled burger makes up for it. One of the best burgers ever!

I always thought The Chuck Box was a dive bar that was known for their burgers...man was I wrong!

Very simple decor. Very simple. To the point that you may think "Do I really wanna eat here?". You do!

The prices are more than affordable and you get a good amount of food for what you pay. The staff was nice, the food was really good, and my only real complaint is that the center "island" that has all the fixins was really low.

This is a great place for a quick, hearty bite.

One of my favorite burger places! Char grilled and delicious! I usually have the "Tijuana Torpedo". Football shaped patty with green chili's and your choice of cheese. Then you have a large choice of condiments at the condiments bar. 
For a side ordered jalapeno poppers and deep fried mushrooms. Poppers were great. Mushrooms needed some salt but, other than that, good.

Haven't been to this place in a looooong looooong time. Mainly because it was too close to ASU and working as a TA there was not the safest place to scape from my students.

The good side is the grilled patty!! that is a winner on it's own!! then you have completely freedom to do your burger the way you want to. Juan knows better!

Chuck Box, I love you. Are you perfect? No. Are you completely sanitary? Probably not. Do you conveniently take credit cards? Perish the thought. But you serve one helluva good burger. Give me a tijiuana torpedo and some jalapeno poppers and I'll forget all your flaws.
The  burgers were very tasty. Fast and friendly service. I will definitely be a repeat customer.

This little dive is such a sentimental piece of my life. My father has been coming to the chuck box since it opened 45 years ago, and he has been bringing our family ever since. We have spent countless years having dinner here before the ASU football games and I can't imagine ever going anywhere else when I'm in the neighborhood. The menu is simple and the most important tip is that they are CASH ONLY!! Take head people , and bring your cash. You get to stand and watch as they grill your burger and fry your sides right in front of you. The place is tiny , for big events they set up and extra grill their parking lot with tables and chairs to help accommodate their dedicated fans . I swear to you they are the Best burgers in Tempe ! Go try them , you won't be disappointed
Best burgers ever!! Definitely try out the "Great Big One" or the "Tijuana Torpedo" (A little messy, but definitely worth it!).

While cruising down University killing some time, my friend noticed The Chuck Box, and stated that we had to go there.  Other than the obvious mentioning of hamburgers, we had no idea what to expect, but based on the fact that it was a little wooden shack that was spouting smoke, we assumed it HAD to be good, and right up our alley.

Later that night after a Fall League baseball game, we decided that it was the perfect time to try The Chuck Box.  The parking is a little sparse, but there was space for me, so no complaints there.  The exterior is about as dive-y as I would have guessed, to no complaints there either.  Upon entering, the interior is total dive, wooden walls, tables, benches and stools.  No velvet ropes here, but a bigass chain to separate those in line with the rest of the customers.

I ordered a Big Juan, and savored the pleasant aroma of a slab of beef going onto the grill right before my eyes.  It was cooked perfectly to order, and I took my time at the condiment area to load it up with what I like.  But not too much to eliminate the flavor of the beef, which was cooked just right, still a little juicy, but nice and warm, with good natural flavor.

My only knock on it is the cash-only policy.  There is an ATM there, but typically I don't carry cash on me, but since I was being all touristy, I was prepared.  But that just meant I had to pay for my ill-prepared friend who was being too cheap to get decked with ATM surcharges.

Otherwise, The Chuck Box was a fantastic find, and well worth the experience, and was a fine burger overall.

This is still the gold standard for burger's in the Valley for me.  The Tijuana Torpedo is my go to, although I've had all their burgers.  They throw green chilis on their WOOD FIRE pit and grill them, before placing a fresh patty of beef which has pepper jack cheese pounded into it, and then throw hot sauce on it (which is not really hot, it's more of a chulula type thing).  It's freakin' huge, and it's so good because of the method of cooking with the wood.  

You pick your own fixins and then sit down in a cool saloon-ish vibed place and just enjoy your burger.  I live in Scottsdale and will trek down to Tempe just to get it sometimes.  Yeah, it's THAT good.

I've eaten here every time I'm in Tempe.  It's a 5 minute walk from most places on the ASU campus.  Really good charcoal grilled burgers,  the fries and rings are okay but not spectacular.  But I like the no frills setup and self serve condiment bar.  Cash only.  Arrive hungry and leave satisfied!

Seems they switched their veggie burger to some sort of store bought crap. Which sucks, they had an awesome veggie burger. Oh well, its lucky I'm an omnivore! 

Still an awesome place to eat, but I miss that veggie burger!

By no means the best burger I've ever had but still quite good. The guacamole bacon cheese burger was especially tasty. 
The atmosphere is awesome, no fuss.

My husband and I were looking for a Port of Subs that he swore he'd seen in Tempe, and while we never found it, we ended up at The Chuckbox!  And I'm glad we did, because it was delicious!  It's sort of like a Fuddruckers, but I think the burgers were waaay better!  I got the guacamole bacon burger.  The guacamole wasn't the best I've had, but it was pretty decent.  They cook the burgers on an open flame right in front of you so when you get them they're hot and juicy and delicious!  I also got onion rings, which were pretty darn good as well.  I will definitely go back there whenever I'm feigning a burger!

Chuck Box is amazing. It is the best Burger Joint in town and an amazing place to get a burger. They grill the burger right in front of you, the staff is awesome, you decorate your own food, and my favorite to order is a great big one with onion rings and a large soda. Thank you chuck box

Jess' fiancee here, D.

I moved to Tempe from Ohio 2 months ago, and as far as burgers have gone, I've been extremely disappointed. "In-n-Out" is supposed to be a legendary chain on the west coast, and I was let down extremely. Smashburger wasn't any better either. So, I talked it over with Jess, and she suggested The Chuck Box. 

Suffice to say, this blew every other place away. I ordered "The Great Big One" a little prematurely, as I saw the "Tijuana Torpedo" only after I ordered :/

Anyway, the burger itself was cooked to a medium perfection. Incredibly fresh, seasoned throughout...couldn't have been a better patty.
The bacon was probably the nicest surprise. Cooked, but not too crispy. Also, IT'S IN THE SHAPE OF YOUR BURGER. Ingenious. 
The condiment bar was a nice addition as well, but shredded lettuce/onions/etc. is a pain in the ass.
